'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-31 14:11:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (12 inline comments)

I have high-level questions about the structure this patch introduces.

Why does "router" dashboard need to be added to the same level
of "admin" and "project"? Now we have three category "admin", "project" and "settings".
I don't think "router" dashboard belongs to the same category.
Could you clarify why "router" (former "Cisco") needs to be added to this level

In addition we have "router" panel ("panel" is a menu in the left side such as "instances", "networks" and so on). If we have same name both in "dashboard" and "panel", it leads t\
o some confusion to end users.

I am afraid I haven't fully understood the profile features and
what the profile feature brings.
Is there any document or pointer to describe this feature?

-----

api/neutron.py is updated. The unit tests for api/neutron needs to be added.

-----

I haven't reviewed the files under dashboard/router/nexus1000v. I am reviewing them.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-31 14:33:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

Some more comments mainly on dashboards/router/nexus1000v/*"}, {'account_id': 6620, 'date': '2013-08-31 15:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Akihiro,
Thanks for the review. I'm on the road right now so I'll get to each comment a little later. 
To provide context - this is the horizon support for the neutron plugin blueprint - https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/cisco-plugin-n1k-support

I have added a link to a short demo in the horizon blueprint for how we envision the new dashboard to be used. It is being used to configure an external router. 

The original idea was to have a dashboard that was vendor specific but one of the review suggestions was that we make the dashboard generic "router" but vendors can add panels as they provide solutions to configure their devices.

I hope this answers some questions at a high level. I will get to the review comments soon.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6659, 'date': '2013-08-31 19:27:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add Cisco N1K plugin support in Horizon

This adds Horizon capability to configure and
use network profiles and policy profiles
on the Cisco Nexus 1000V to be used with
networks and instances as is done via neutron
CLI.

To turn on the new dashboard the local_settings
file needs to turn the profile_settings NEUTRON
config variable to cisco.

TODO items include creating a better palate
of unit tests that will run not only when
the cisco n1k subplugin is being used but
in default setting as well.
Need to remove the conditional statements
in the unit tests and make it inclusive.
Additionally need to get a better solution
for how the dashboard/panel registration will
work. Should it be a boolean or check for vendor
specific names.
Also some cleanup and refactoring of commonly
used code everywhere.

Implements: blueprint horizon-cisco-n1k

Change-Id: If6e797ac28c8486cfa92e02742c409d193d9ec84

[{'created': '2013-08-28 02:32:56.000000000', 'message': "Move _expire_reservations from periodic tasks

if the scheduler hasn't done anything for the past few minutes there is no
reason to keep running this task. Instead it can be restarted upon the
next scheduling event.

Fix bug 1212028

Change-Id: I3eb2b7faca9777494d7edffe89b4e2a803d01c49
"}, {'created': '2013-09-03 09:07:20.000000000', 'message': "Remove _expire_reservations from periodic tasks

Fix bug 1212028

Change-Id: I3eb2b7faca9777494d7edffe89b4e2a803d01c49
"}]
commit_message:
Remove _expire_reservations from periodic tasks

if the scheduler hasn't done anything for the past few minutes there is no
reason to keep running this task. Instead it can be restarted upon the
next scheduling event.

Fix bug 1212028

Change-Id: I3eb2b7faca9777494d7edffe89b4e2a803d01c49

commit_message:
Use yield in nova.cmd.manage.methods_of()

We are able to avoid an extra list creation in this method.
This change cleans up code and improves performance a little bit.

Change-Id: I67f1118ad619759b37a47ce818289969e236aedf

commit_message:
Allow Ambari port to be specified in configuration

Ambari port can now be specified in standard and advanced configuration

Fixes: bug #1212333

Change-Id: I8a0e75df65cfe23e47aa5551fdf74d26403bb106

rather than that of a single host in the cluster.

(cherry picked from commit fddcde6a063d59596f687f0651af94f498f7d9b7)

commit_message:
Fixes host stats for VMWareVCDriver

Host stats for VCDriver should collect aggregate cluster stats
rather than that of a single host in the cluster.

Fixes: bug #1190515

(cherry picked from commit fddcde6a063d59596f687f0651af94f498f7d9b7)

Change-Id: I56b6b027e1370fc2cfdb4d87c10b80574a81b225

Will review the blueprint after H2 has been cut.'}, {'account_id': 1038, 'date': '2013-07-15 21:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This is an important feature, thanks for doing this work.  A couple of comments/questions.

I might have expected to see neutron make use of the code in openstack/common/service.py.  Did you consider using that code?

We had developed a patch for this that we've been running for a couple months.  We've been meaning to offer up the patch, and your change here has prompted us to do so: https://review.openstack.org/37131 is a WIP for discussion purposes.  It is based on similar code in glance (because the engineer that did the work was familiar with the glance code, and it seemed less intrusive than moving to the openstack/common code).

Last, I am not able to access the specification that is  linked to the blueprint, docs.google.com says "you don't have permission to access this item".  Not sure if this is problem on my end or not, can you check?

Thanks, 

- Jack'}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-07-16 00:29:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for your comments, Jack.

It's my oversight about openstack/common/service.py, looks more elegant to reuse the existing codes. I will delete the repetitive code in the patch.

And the specification is open now.

Yingjun"}, {'account_id': 4428, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 14:55:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Multiple processes support for API server

Add option 'api_workers' to use multiple processes for api server

Implement blueprint multi-workers-for-api-server

DocImpact

Change-Id: I93276b059e8e273dc3d01dc3b9ced7f237a53ad9

Some problems here:

1) This isn't a bug, it's a feature, so it should have a blueprint.

2) There should be tests included.

I should also note that usually we can't add new features to an API except by using an API extension.  I think that simply adding another property may be OK though.  We at least have that documented as something generally acceptable in the API change guidelines wiki page:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/APIChangeGuidelines

I would certainly like to know if anyone disagrees with that, though."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-10 13:25:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Add a new property "status" to hosts index function

When we execute 'nova host-list' command, except the basic information about the host,
we also want to know the services' status on the hosts just by one time. Whether the service
is up, just like 'nova-manage service list', so I added this new feature to index function in
contrib/hosts.py and plugins/v3/hosts.py by using service_group.API().

At the same time, I refactor the test data for hosts-list test case both in xml and json formats.
Now, when using the command 'nova host-list', you can get "host_name, service, status, zone" properties.

Change-Id: Ib3c59bc74cd2dbf552a897c90053d7d0e2a07ffb
Related Bug 1076521
Blueprint host-list

commit_message:
Add the shared flag when creating a Firewall

When creating a firewall, the shared flag was not being passed to
the Firewall class. This fix adds the missing flag.

Change-Id: Iaf4b0a16593ac505cb548dc99d5b53cf2999e0b1
Fixes: bug #1215191

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 04:02:01.000000000', 'message': 'add compat for rackspace's create user impl (bug 1214686)

According to the Identity API v2.0 spec, create user uses a 'username'
attribute instead of a 'name' attribute. Rackspace implemented the spec
correctly and Keystone did not. We now have two conflicting sources of
"truth," so revising the contract to reflect the "truth" isn't really an
option. As a compromise, we can handle both implementations on the
client side.

Change-Id: I1f0aa5b469adea78cce7481f2788eae97e967d10
'}, {'created': '2013-08-21 17:31:35.000000000', 'message': 'add compat for rackspace's create user impl (bug 1214686)

According to the Identity API v2.0 spec, create user uses a 'username'
attribute instead of a 'name' attribute. Rackspace implemented the spec
correctly and Keystone did not. We now have two conflicting sources of
"truth," so revising the contract to reflect the "truth" isn't really an
option. As a compromise, we can handle both implementations on the
client side.

Change-Id: I1f0aa5b469adea78cce7481f2788eae97e967d10
'}]
commit_message:
add compat for rackspace's create user impl (bug 1214686)

According to the Identity API v2.0 spec, create user uses a 'username'
attribute instead of a 'name' attribute. Rackspace implemented the spec
correctly and Keystone did not. We now have two conflicting sources of
"truth," so revising the contract to reflect the "truth" isn't really an
option. As a compromise, we can handle both implementations on the
client side.

Change-Id: I1f0aa5b469adea78cce7481f2788eae97e967d10

commit_message:
remove openstack.common.context

The context module is no longer maintained by oslo-incubator. This
patch removes dependency of openstack.common.context from neutron
codebase, the openstack.common.notifier still depends on it but it
is oslo's own problem. This behaviour is same as nova, cinder and
glance.

Fixes: Bug #1210261

Change-Id: I925e76bb2c75279b384712e8f3d3679878d58006

commit_message:
Updating HACKING.rst

* Adding a test case independence rule
* assertTrue/assertFalse msg argument
* Encouraging  matcher usage for assertion

Change-Id: I89612a0dd66513f10e8bf53632f6a3d81ccf4129

commit_message:
Property Protection Layer

This patch introduces the property protection layer and the tests
associated with it

Related to bp api-v2-property-protection

Change-Id: Iaf2111bf07377ef6a4c89a621888077cc14be776

commit_message:
Rule parser for property protections

This patch introduces the way protected properties
will be configured and parsed.

Related to bp api-v2-property-protection
docImpact

Change-Id: I3d24cacccf3f51b07a4090b8a5db1f2451090762

commit_message:
OAuth authorizing user should propose roles to delegate

Currently in the oauth1 extension the consumer specifies roles
instead of delegator. This is a design fault that should be fixed
by having the authorizing user provide a set of roles (ids)
during the authorize request token phase.

fixes bug: #1216408

Change-Id: I13e155cf04dd478d575c8d66216d0fde08875ba2

commit_message:
Update schema descriptions to indicate readonly

Longer term we may look into using the json hyper-schema readonly
attribute, but for now this will allow the user to see up-front
which properties are actually read-only and cannot be changed.

Change-Id: I8c8b94732c219fe61caa584527921b65217bea30

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 6820, 'date': '2013-09-04 16:21:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Small question about multi-segment support on agents: they are actually assuming that there is a 1:1 binding between network and segment. Couldn't this lead to misconfigurations if multiple segments of a network are bound to the same agent?

Returning segment_id instead of network_id in get_device_details may help to fix that (but may also have side effects)"}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-09-04 17:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Francois,

This merge works with the recent ml2-portbinding merge so that the mechanism driver for the agent determines which segment will be used based on bridge or interface mapping info sent from the agent to the server and stored via agents_db. The get_device_details RPC returns the details of only the selected segment to the agent.

-Bob'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-09-04 19:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

reverify no bug'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-04 19:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Fails

commit_message:
Add support for the multiprovider API to ML2

This implements support for creating provider networks with
multiple different segments with the ML2 plugin.

Implements: blueprint ml2-multi-segment-api

Change-Id: Id6fc22841fddabfbe685de9605d4a4682ee1102d

commit_message:
Notify error not called on upload errors in V2

The 'upload' method in glance/api/v2/image_data.py catches a couple of
exceptions, but does not send notifications for any of them. They should
also be sending notifications as is being done in v1.

Fixes: Bug #1217837
Change-Id: Ie38307f514c1716dce31403d9ef57eae8290450d

commit_message:
Generalize the _make_list() function for objects

Each object with a list duplicated the _make_list() method in its
own module. This removes that duplication and adds a generalized
helper in objects/base.py. The instance object still uses its own
because it has to do a bunch of other stuff in the loop for
efficiency.

Change-Id: Ic910f39087ebc167b2b930979f7951116caf8598

commit_message:
refactor - _is_timed_out using instance timeout

Each _is_timed_out client specified self.timeout as timeout parameter.
As _is_timed_out is an instance method, timeout parameter could be
retrieved from the object itself.

Change-Id: I56c6d5a21a36cf052d3bde86c454d7be72b22a7c

commit_message:
Add default auth_uri setting for auth token.

The latest keystoneclient code now gives a Warning if auth_uri
isn't explicitly specified.

Change-Id: I0feb52f7a9140ea750254f80b6a3e6855b25f1d3

commit_message:
VMware: Nova boot from cinder volume

Part of blueprint vmware-nova-cinder-support

This patch adds support for booting from a cinder volume.

Change-Id: Ic2104ddda759dbfb3f352b547b417c910d75d9db

commit_message:
add flavor creation tests

1. verify that it can deal with string ram parameter
2. make sure it can detect invalid ram and vcpus

Change-Id: Ic439cdf6b8ff99c7b13efc849afb92b4b0865392

[{'created': '2013-09-02 13:08:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove _report_driver_status from compute/manager.py

After the blueprint no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler, there is no
need for nova compute to fanout its capabilities to nova scheduler,
so we can remove _report_driver_status as it is no use now.

Change-Id: I749204d7d6461993d0c42bf5877b65c5ec17c62f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove _report_driver_status from compute/manager.py

After the blueprint no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler, there is no
need for nova compute to fanout its capabilities to nova scheduler,
so we can remove _report_driver_status as it is no use now.

Change-Id: I749204d7d6461993d0c42bf5877b65c5ec17c62f

This patch makes sure that even if we receive an ephemeral or swap BDM
without size information - it is defaulted to 0 by the compute service
prior to booting the VM, as the size is expected to be present and an
integer number by the driver code that uses it.

Closes-bug: #1218861

Change-Id: Ic6fc15d1cf876aa4fd99e17c582c1ab55e3a18c1
'}, {'created': '2013-09-02 12:01:18.000000000', 'message': 'Interpret BDM None size field as 0 on compute side

This patch makes sure that even if we receive an ephemeral or swap BDM
without size information - it is defaulted to 0 by the compute service
prior to booting the VM, as the size is expected to be present and an

Change-Id: Ic6fc15d1cf876aa4fd99e17c582c1ab55e3a18c1

commit_message:
Interpret BDM None size field as 0 on compute side

This patch makes sure that even if we receive an ephemeral or swap BDM
without size information - it is defaulted to 0 by the compute service
prior to booting the VM, as the size is expected to be present and an
integer number by the driver code that uses it.

Closes-bug: #1218861

Change-Id: Ic6fc15d1cf876aa4fd99e17c582c1ab55e3a18c1

commit_message:
Fix to disallow server name with all blank spaces (v3 API)

Prevents a server name to be created, updated or rebuilt with all blank characters.
A fix for the V2 API was merged in commit 98ff29d13af9e0c1fa96e49e68939634c24ad2c3
but was not applied to the V3 API.

Fixes bug 1212096

Change-Id: Ibaf0ca7a766b6a279a83f56165edbf8ced29d5fa

commit_message:
VlanManager creates superfluous quota reservations

The VlanManager does not enforce quotas on fixed IPs because it
allocates an entire network to a project. However the process
of deallocating an IP address still creates an entry in the
reservations table.

The VlanManager now loads the NoopQuotaDriver and no longer
writes superflously to the database.

Change-Id: Idf95085a5c1f4e71f3f0fc92618607073602eed3
Fixes: Bug #1204714

commit_message:
change database's ip to localhost in cinder.conf

As mentioned in "Set up the cinder database.",
the "PRIVILEGES" giving to cinder are local, so the
localhost will be given permission

fixes Bug1214764

Change-Id: I78a1fb124eeb0770761ad4afd4228c5a49250355

commit_message:
Use utils.execute instead of subprocess

Removes rogue subprocess.Popen calls to make better use of
nova.utils.execute where appropriate to benefit from the
patches pushed into oslo.

Fixes bug 1053382

Change-Id: Iaee5379edd51f215a51d55263196dd6c0d2de0c3

commit_message:
vm_state and task_state not updated during instance delete

This bug was recently introduced during conversion of the
terminate_instance to the new object models.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36363
Fixed by calling the save method of the new model.
Also updated tests to use primitive instance so it is
converted to new object model by object_compat decorator
in the compute manager.

Related to: blueprint compute-api-objects
Fixes: bug #1212496
Change-Id: I4f4e45160008d3eb57f4f0935f13e22b6a561430

Blueprint: hyper-v-ephemeral-storage

This patchset adds support for creating an ephemeral storage dynamic
VHD or VHDX (based on the versions of vhdutils used) when an instance is
spawned.

The ephemeral disk is correctly migrated during migration/resize and
live migration.

The ephemeral virtual disk is not partitioned or formatted, leaving the
task to guest side tools (e.g.: cloud-init or cloudbase-init).

commit_message:
Adds ephemeral storage support for Hyper-V

Blueprint: hyper-v-ephemeral-storage

This patchset adds support for creating an ephemeral storage dynamic
VHD or VHDX (based on the versions of vhdutils used) when an instance is
spawned.

The ephemeral disk is correctly migrated during migration/resize and
live migration.

The ephemeral virtual disk is not partitioned or formatted, leaving the
task to guest side tools (e.g.: cloud-init or cloudbase-init).

Change-Id: I0b5d6b55ccdc981efcd507c45184fb2d528bf9c1

subject: Adds Hyper-V VHDX support

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-03 23:21:06.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Hyper-V VHDX support

Blueprint: hyper-v-vhdx

The VHDX virtual disk format has been introduced with Hyper-V Server 2012
providing performance and management improvements.

Unlike the VHD format, VHDX allows to resize differencing disks. This
reduces the requirements for local disk space in case of CoW images and
improves the performance of the first spawn operation for any given image
and flavor combination.

Supporting the VHDX format in Hyper-V requires the WMI V2 namespace.

Unit tests have been added accordingly.

Change-Id: Idddec06b9639e22d69426562d1b5a0cbf2890ccf

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V VHDX support

Blueprint: hyper-v-vhdx

The VHDX virtual disk format has been introduced with Hyper-V Server 2012
providing performance and management improvements.

Unlike the VHD format, VHDX allows to resize differencing disks. This
reduces the requirements for local disk space in case of CoW images and
improves the performance of the first spawn operation for any given image
and flavor combination.

Supporting the VHDX format in Hyper-V requires the WMI V2 namespace.

Unit tests have been added accordingly.

Change-Id: Idddec06b9639e22d69426562d1b5a0cbf2890ccf

'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-07-27 17:17:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Comments inline.

Also, is there really a need to add the dynamic_memory flag? In the interest of reducing configuration option proliferation, could we just set dynamic memory if the ratio is >1.0?

Looking further, I also wonder if ram_allocation_ratio is really what you think it is here. Memory ballooning and overcommit are two different things in other hypervisors. Overcommiting by 1.5x means using the host's swap to overcommit the actual available memory. Ballooning means reducing or adding memory to the guest while it's running (i.e. memory hotplug on linux)."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-07-29 14:53:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Hi Dan, although the ram_alocation_ratio can be implemented differently on different hypervisors architectures, it's meaning can be still reduced to being able to overcommit RAM, which in Hyper-V can be performed only via ballooning.

Being the ram_allocation_ratio a scheduler option, IMO is not tied to any specific hypervisor or overcommit technical solution. The definition is actually quite general: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/scheduler/filters/ram_filter.py#L28

As a consequence, the scheduler will fail it allocating VMs on Hyper-V when overcommitting without enabling ballooning.

Said that, our original implementation had a dedicated Hyper-V parameter, we moved to ram_allocation_ratio to avoid the parameters proliferation issue.

I'm absolutely open to revert to it, removing at that point the dynamic_memory parameter."}, {'account_id': 7934, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-29 16:06:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-09-04 12:55:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

As a general question, I wonder whether having a nova.conf option is going to be sufficient granularity for this. Wouldn't be surprised if we find users want to control this per-flavour instead. Not going to block for that though - its easy enough todo later if it turns out to be important."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-09-04 13:06:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

It'd be great to be able to control it a the flavor or image level, I was actually thinking about solutions for that, IMO this is a topic for the design summit."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-09-04 13:09:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

So this adds a new dynamic_memory_ratio=1.0 option
which is honored by hyperv only for now.

I guess in future xen and kvm could leverage it too?

For reference also related is the general RamFilter ram_allocation_ratio=1.5 option, which sets the overcommit limit.

Are there any implications for the RamFilter,
which currently compares against 'requested_ram'?"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-09-04 13:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Yes, dynamic_memory_ratio in under the "hyperv" options group, so other drivers can define different behaviours as needed. It'd be great of course to have a common one.

Originally (see the first patch) we used ram_allocation_ratio as basically we follow the same arithmetic in setting the ratio. We changed it to a different one on dansmith's request (see his review above, he didn't review it afterwards yet).

Optimally, a ram_allocation_ratio is matched by an equivalent dynamic_memory_ratio value on the compute nodes.'}, {'account_id': 5371, 'date': '2013-09-04 14:21:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks good, would be nice to see a unit test for setting the new config option to something non-integer, since it looks like a floating point. Something like 1.5 or 2.5 would be good to test as well for coverage.'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-09-04 14:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Thanks Mathew, the value is assigned to a WMI object, which is consequently mocked, so we cannot test the actual reaction of the WMI object on different values. The only way to make sure that the WMI object is through CI tests. We are working on setting up a CI infrastructure in time for Icehouse.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-09-04 14:41:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 12:04:13.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Hyper-V dynamic memory support

Blueprint: hyper-v-dynamic-memory

Memory overcommit in Hyper-V is handled with a feature called dynamic
memory (memory ballooning). This change adds a configuration option to
enable it along with the required changes for both V1 and V2 WMI APIs.

The initial startup memory is obtained from the "ram_allocation_ratio".
This will mantain a consistent behavior among nova-scheduler and Hyper-V
compute nodes withot requiring additional configuration options.

Unit tests have been added for this feature as well.

Signed-off-by: Robert Tingirica <rtingirica@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I036eaa3e739d995c6a5bcfb022bf2ed0a999085e
'}, {'created': '2013-07-29 15:19:13.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Hyper-V dynamic memory support

Blueprint: hyper-v-dynamic-memory

Memory overcommit in Hyper-V is handled with a feature called dynamic
memory (memory ballooning). This change adds a configuration option to
enable it along with the required changes for both V1 and V2 WMI APIs.

The initial startup memory is obtained from the "ram_allocation_ratio".
This will mantain a consistent behavior among nova-scheduler and Hyper-V
compute nodes without requiring additional configuration options.

Unit tests have been added for this feature as well.

Signed-off-by: Robert Tingirica <rtingirica@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I036eaa3e739d995c6a5bcfb022bf2ed0a999085e
'}, {'created': '2013-08-09 16:43:50.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Hyper-V dynamic memory support

Blueprint: hyper-v-dynamic-memory

Memory overcommit in Hyper-V is handled with a feature called dynamic
memory (memory ballooning). This change adds a configuration option to
enable it.

The value of dynamic_memory_ratio expresses the ratio between the total
RAM assigned to an instance and its startup RAM amount. For example a
ratio of 2.0 for an instance with 1024MB of RAM implies 512MB of RAM
allocated at startup.

Unit tests have been added for this feature as well.

commit_message:
Adds Hyper-V dynamic memory support

Blueprint: hyper-v-dynamic-memory

Memory overcommit in Hyper-V is handled with a feature called dynamic
memory (memory ballooning). This change adds a configuration option to
enable it.

The value of dynamic_memory_ratio expresses the ratio between the total
RAM assigned to an instance and its startup RAM amount. For example a
ratio of 2.0 for an instance with 1024MB of RAM implies 512MB of RAM
allocated at startup.

Unit tests have been added for this feature as well.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I036eaa3e739d995c6a5bcfb022bf2ed0a999085e

commit_message:
Closes-Bug: #1195571 -- Updated quotas section with new info.

Updated quotas section with already updated Admin User Guide info.
Now contains info for both Compute and Block Storage quotas. Also
switched out <> for <replaceable> tags, and deleted a couple of
white spaces.

Updates to 1.9.2 of maven plugin in pom.xml.

Change-Id: I74c269020209323d69b5bd293e7d8fcd3ad5e3fe

See http://aa4698cc2bf4ab7e5907-ed3df21bb39de4e57eec9a20aa0b8711.r41.cf2.rackcdn.com/api-ref-wrap.png. I'll investigate further."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-08-23 00:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok, it was easier than I thought, but before I "fix" I want to see what you think. 

The wrap won't happen on an "_" (underbar), it only wraps on a "-" (dash). I can patch with stack-id instead of stack_id but I don't know if that'll change meaning elsewhere. Let me know.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-08-23 08:00:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Sounds good to me. This is only used to generate docs, so s/_/-/ should be no problem.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-08-24 23:39:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (9 inline comments)

Well, we have to maintain a standard for all the APIs so we need to use underbar for substitutions. Hyphen has meaning for extensions so I don't want to cause confusion there either. The pending fix is to add a zero-width space at build time which will line break properly and also allow copy/paste from this page. For this fix, we'll wait for a release of 1.9.3 of the clouddocs-maven-plugin, which is pending further testing of the parameter display. Sorry for the delay. I do have some nitpicks in the mean time."}, {'account_id': 2834, 'date': '2013-08-27 19:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-27 19:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'account_id': 7135, 'date': '2013-08-30 08:11:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks good. One minor issue to address - resource records are no longer removed from the database during stack-delete, so we need to update purge_deleted as well, https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L399. Otherwise the hard deletion of stack records would fail because of the foreign key reference from the soft deleted resource records."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-08-30 10:07:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Looks excellent, thanks :)

One issue discussed inline; if I understand correctly, fixing that will resolve Liang's concern also."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-09-03 07:49:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Implement parallel delete

This is first patch in the series to implement parallel delete
and it includes following changes:

1. changing Stack.delete to use stack_task
2. In Resource.delete polling for check_delete_complete
3. Updating unit tests to use TaskRunner for resource.delete and
   resource.destroy

Blueprint parallel-delete

Change-Id: I8a96b1a956388372c29f9f45445f397467667110

[{'created': '2013-08-12 13:27:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix AggregateDBApiTestCase on PostreSQL and MySQL

Test methods of AggregateDBApiTestCase use hard-coded
instance ids values instead of ones returned by *_create()
DB API methods. This imposes the following restriction on
autoincrement behavior: it must always start with 1 (which
might not be true, if a DB is not recreated for each test
case).

Change-Id: I4712c5d91c22b3b531048340f3cc827ce5ac438d

commit_message:
Fix AggregateDBApiTestCase on PostreSQL and MySQL

Test methods of AggregateDBApiTestCase use hard-coded
instance ids values instead of ones returned by *_create()
DB API methods. This imposes the following restriction on
autoincrement behavior: it must always start with 1 (which
might not be true, if a DB is not recreated for each test
case).

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: I4712c5d91c22b3b531048340f3cc827ce5ac438d

In general, it looks good to me. 

Please remove the SECRET_KEY generation stuff from local_settings.py.example, too.

I'd also expect, apache (or any other webserver process) is not able to write to the specified file, IMHO we should prevent the web server from having write access to the directory containing source code at all.

What about writing to '/tmp'?"}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-09-04 19:50:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Matthias: I see your point(s), however I don't think the proper decisions are obvious. I actually left the local_settings.py.example bit on purpose because I think people should be made as aware of SECRET_KEY as possible, and writing to /tmp has both pros and cons. I'd like to revisit this as a ticket in RC1 and go ahead with the merge to fix this for the H3 cut. I've filed https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1220884 to track."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-04 19:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

commit_message:
Moves SECRET_KEY generation to base settings.py file

By putting the fallback SECRET_KEY generation into the base
settings.py file we can ensure there is always a SECRET_KEY
even if local_settings.py doesn't exist. All this really does
is move the current default in local_settings.py into
settings.py.

This fixes the failures during docs building, etc. due to
SECRET_KEY not being set.

Contains a few changes to fix errors/warnings during
docs building as well.

Fixes bug 1188622 and fixes bug 1178663.

Change-Id: I5d945deba7062fe42bcee2e7636ca4a8f4607a31

commit_message:
Move _generate_paste_config to tests.core

Seeing as how tests for oauth1 and endpoint filtering each have
their own private functions for creating a new paste-ini file,
I think it's best to move these to tests.core.
Future extensions will benefit from this too.

fixes bug: #1218720

Change-Id: Ic31b78dda0a66ddc4c4214bca4ba3b683d554886

commit_message:
ensure that Arista test destroys the database

Out of order test execution has revealed that the database was not
properly cleaned up after each test run.  This patch adds a call to
clear the database after each test.

Fixes bug: 1220784

Change-Id: I8a706887f89f21ede88177e441a3b562fd8f74dc

Thanks Dan. This will cause problem for resize with CoreFilter.

nova.conf==================
scheduler_default_filters = CoreFilter
cpu_allocation_ratio = 1

===============================
Suppose the HV has only 4 cpus.

================================
root@liugya-ubuntu:~# nova flavor-list
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+
| ID | Name | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs | RXTX_Factor | Is_Public |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+
| 1 | m1.tiny | 512 | 1 | 0 | | 1 | 1.0 | True |
| 2 | m1.small | 2048 | 20 | 0 | | 1 | 1.0 | True |
| 3 | m1.medium | 4096 | 40 | 0 | | 2 | 1.0 | True |
| 4 | m1.large | 8192 | 80 | 0 | | 4 | 1.0 | True |
| 42 | m1.nano | 64 | 0 | 0 | | 1 | 1.0 | True |
| 5 | m1.xlarge | 16384 | 160 | 0 | | 8 | 1.0 | True |
| 6 | m2.tiny | 512 | 0 | 0 | | 8 | 1.0 | True |
| 7 | m2.tiny2 | 128 | 0 | 0 | | 3 | 1.0 | True |
| 84 | m1.micro | 128 | 0 | 0 | | 1 | 1.0 | True |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+

=========================================
1) Boot a VM with flavor 1 (512M memory, 1 vcpu)
2) Resize the VM to flavor 6 (512M memory, 8 vcpu)
3) The filter should check flavor 6 and return false as there are not enough cpus on the hypervisor
4) But the request_spec still using old flavor, this will lead CoreFilter return True even there are not enough cpus on the hypervisor'}, {'account_id': 7494, 'date': '2013-08-16 02:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
No need to construct instance type when resize VM

When resize a VM, the instance_type in request_spec is still
old flavor, this will cause some problem if scheduler want to
get new instance type from rquest_spec. An example would be
when resize with CoreFilter or RamFilter.

Since when resize a VM, the new flavor is already passed to
migrate_server, so when build request_spec, use the new flavor
directly without constructing it from instance.

Fix bug 1209288

Change-Id: I3fa97820771e71a135f9c1f57b9bda98a9fc0843

commit_message:
Add in place update of type on existing volume

Adds the ability to change the volume_type of an existing
volume without migration.  This will allow things like forcing
the driver to re-read and update behaviors contained in extra-specs.

Utilizes the filter scheduler to determine if the current volume
host supports the desired type change, if not the retype will
not succeed.

******************* WIP ***********************

Implements bp volume_retype

Change-Id: Icb0fc7e85c5e59a346b8e51f67a0d4f06aed872c

commit_message:
Change resize_instance paths to use objects

Converts calls to compute's resize_instance to pass new-world instance
and migration objects.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Idad237ca76b4a28dc80792ad195b95db224161ae

commit_message:
Fix the code miss to show the correct error messages

In keystone/common/ldap/core.py I found the code like below:

 86 raise ValueError(_(
 87 'Invalid LDAP TLS certs option: %(option). '
 88 'Choose one of: %(options)s') % {

The code "%(option)" in line 87 should be fixed to "%(option)s" to
show the correct error messages when the exception happens.
This patch fixes this error.

Fixes bug #1220601

Change-Id: I87328080facd4d9b1349a677c00a93d118993538

commit_message:
Engine, task, flow, patterns unification

Instead of keeping the existing flows with there functionality
move the existing flows to just be the thing that defines the
runtime structure. Have the action_engine translate these
structures into something useful, which in the case of action_engine
is translating the structures into things that are pretty much
like the existing flows (but not exactly).

Change-Id: Ia4773b28418a6fab42c8dbd1ebfbe88c1879a4be

commit_message:
The functionality of tasks is the same as runners

Reuse the same runner class instead of recreating a
miniature version for blocks.

Change-Id: Iab5c37bf83398bd40ff8c4a58d30133cb321a019

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError exception in autoscaling

Use the nested() method instead of directly accessing the _nested
attribute which isn't always initialized.

Fixes bug #1220737
Change-Id: I9f36d98e91d5175b354e423d7159e690b1e5b696

commit_message:
Add missing foreign key

Chassis table is created after nodes table, there
is missing foreign key nodes.chassis_id -> chassis.id.
This patch adds missing FK in separate migration.

Change-Id: Ic82181c7aa85515a5a2bba49c8dc8d35b495742c

commit_message:
Sync models with migrations

Ironic project use migrations for create DB.
There is difference between DB after all migrations
and models. This patch fix models and sync them
with real DB state after all migrations.

Change-Id: Ic2c44519d51699b2223d8252baa6a3da1f412795

Porting nova pxe driver to ironic

Implements: blueprint equivalent-pxe-driver

I am just starting to look at this and notice what looks like openstack common syncing mixed in with this patch.  With nova, we tend to separate these patches.  Ie, create a patch set that syncs oslo...  and then create another patch that depends on it which uses the oslo functionality that you need.

Also:  You should only sync the oslo files that you actually need.  I assume this would be limited to the db directory.

I'll review the rest of this now..."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-08-12 18:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-13 16:51:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Let me start out by saying that I'm very interested to have the tpool api wrapper from common usable in glance for the sqlalchemy driver.

However, this change unfortunately takes an approach that pours a lot of cement around existing interfaces, which are essentially legacy and unsustainable. 

1) it assumes a monolithic db api
2) it assumes certain config changes

All of this to reuse a tiny bit of code, essentially

def generic_function(name, *args, **kwargs):
    tpool.execute(self.getattr(name), *args, **kwargs)

which I'm not really that worried about duplicating across projects anyway.


I think comstud has some great ideas about how we can pare this change down, I spoke to him some about it offline."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-13 16:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-08-13 16:59:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Comment inline.  I don't think that'll be enough to satisfy Mark, however.

An alternative to this whole patch is to skip using oslo completely for now.  You could have sqlalchemy backend define the use_tpool option... and create a decorator that you slap onto every method in that file that wraps the call with a tpool.execute() if the conf option is on.

That would limit changes to the sqlalchemy backend... and would not complicate Mark's refactoring plans.

Mark: Is this latter option what you would prefer for now?"}, {'account_id': 7531, 'date': '2013-08-16 12:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

We still need to have a db api interface, which would wrap the sqlalchemy method in a tpool thread. This would ensure that only the calls made to sqlalchemy api from outside are wrapped and calls within sqlalchemy do not spawn new threads.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-08-16 23:43:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Eventlet takes care of that so that it does not deadlock.  It will detect if it's already running in a tpool and just run the call within the current thread."}, {'account_id': 7531, 'date': '2013-08-20 15:19:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 16:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-08-22 17:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

How about writing this all in glance/db/__init__.py?

  class ThreadPoolWrapper(object):
      def __init__(self, wrapped):
          self.wrapped = wrapped

      def __getattr__(self, key):
          original = getattr(self.wrapped, key)
          if not callable(original):
              return original
          return self.wrap(original)

      def wrap(self, method):
          def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):
              return tpool.execute(method, *args, **kwargs)


And then use this class to wrap the imported module if an option like "db_use_tpool" is set in glance.db.get_api()

This is an approach more similar to how oslo works, so you should probably try to merge this code into oslo and refactor the oslo code so that the mechanism for wrapping an object with tpool is not coupled to the db api object. Then glance can delete its custom tpool wrapper.'}, {'account_id': 7531, 'date': '2013-08-26 14:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-26 15:27:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-08-28 22:41:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

It would be cool if someone could explain to me how this works exactly. How does doing the db_api call in a thread make db calls non-blocking. Or better yet, how were they blocking to begin with?

I'm assuming that sqlalchemy doing db calls is not a 'green' operation, but what does that mean exactly? Am I right when I think that this patch fixes the issue of every thread waiting on db calls to finish?

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-09-01 02:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Alex: Sure, I can explain.  sqlalchemy uses the mysqldb python module by default which underneath uses the C libmysqlclient.  Since the C library itself contains all of the socket code, eventlet does not/can not wrap it.  Any time we enter the C library, it blocks the current real Thread... and in openstack since we generally only have 1 real Thread, it blocks the whole process.  This same Thread is what contains all of our greenthreads so they cannot be switched to.  All DB calls run completely serially.

By using a Thread pool (real threads), we gain the ability of having multiple DB calls running in parallel because the GIL is unlocked while code within libmysqlclient is running.  Also, the original Thread with all of the greenthreads also has the ability to run.

Something like that. :)'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-09-01 02:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-09-04 17:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I do hope we can promote that ThreadPoolWrapper code to common for use with oslo.db.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-09-04 18:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-04 18:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: No score

commit_message:
Introduced DB pooling for non blocking DB calls

The DbApi module is wrapped with the tpool wrapper if the configuration is
enabled. use_tpool is disabled (False) by default

Related to bp mysql-thread-pool

Change-Id: Ie7274ac855549b96c581c3eb0bcf79f3c74be0ed

commit_message:
Port Cheetah templates to Jinja2

Cheetah is unmaintained since 2010 and it's unlikely to get Python3
support soon. Also, the rest of OpenStack (mostly) standardized on
Jinja2.

Implements: blueprint jinja-templating-conversion
Change-Id: Ia15f00ee96d3c1d55d7c290f20ccc988e4c52e1a

Fix bug #1220454

Change-Id: I2b88eb28593043843a9ac0afd5bff7c268db0f60
'}, {'created': '2013-09-04 00:10:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove versioning from IOVisor APIs PATH

Fix bug #1220454

In the first version of the IOVisor driver, versioning was included in the
the PATH of the native IOVisor commands which was /opt/pg/bin/0/
In the current version, versioning has been deleted from the PATH and
now it should only include /opt/pg/bin/

Change-Id: I2b88eb28593043843a9ac0afd5bff7c268db0f60
'}]
commit_message:
Remove versioning from IOVisor APIs PATH

Fix bug #1220454

In the first version of the IOVisor driver, versioning was included in the
the PATH of the native IOVisor commands which was /opt/pg/bin/0/
In the current version, versioning has been deleted from the PATH and
now it should only include /opt/pg/bin/

Change-Id: I2b88eb28593043843a9ac0afd5bff7c268db0f60

commit_message:
Add group by statistics in API v2

Implements blueprint api-group-by

Add group by statistics in API v2 and group by statistics tests in
API v2 tests as a new class TestGroupByInstance

The tests use the same data and test cases as the groupby storage
tests in class StatisticsGroupByTest

The tests implemented are group by

 1) single field, "user-id"
 2) single field, "resource-id"
 3) single field, "project-id"
 4) single field, "source" (*)
 5) single field with invalid/unknown field value
 6) multiple fields
 7) single field groupby with query filter
 8) multiple field group by with multiple query filters
 9) single field with start timestamp after all samples
10) single field with end timestamp before all samples
11) single field with start timestamp
12) single field with end timestamp
13) single field with start and end timestamps
14) single field with start and end timestamps and query filter
15) single field with start and end timestamps and period
16) single field with start and end timestamps, query filter, and period

(*) Group by source isn't supported in SQLAlchemy at this time, so
    we have to put this test in its own class TestGroupBySource

Group by metadata fields is not implemented at this time.

Also adds a method _validate_groupby_fields() to process the groupby
part of the request, and tests for _validate_groupby_fields().

Change-Id: Ibce1978cfdf70ab068af43a548241546a85bd464

commit_message:
Update the location of the LH driver

When the lefthand driver was pulled from nova into cinder, the
volume_driver location was incorrect. The migration mapped the old
location to the new location;
cinder.volume.drivers.san.HpSanISCSIDriver
This patch is just updating the docs to the correct location.

Change-Id: I60275ee4eb680e479231d94282d2c0731b672946

commit_message:
Add Identity v2 role and service tests

* Add current auth info (auth_ref) to ClientManager
* Fix identity.v2_0.role.ListUserRole to get default user/project
  from ClientManager.auth_ref
* Fix identity.v2_0.role.AddRole call to roles.add_user_role()

Change-Id: Ie8bf41c491d97b0292a2b86bdc9b7580989a7f97

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-02 12:43:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix problem when sending long messages in Qpid

Qpid has a limitation where it cannot serialize a dict containing a
string greater than 65535 characters. This change alters the Qpid
implementation to JSON encode the dict before sending it, but only if
Qpid would fail to serialize it. This maintains as much backward
compatibility as possible, though long messages will still fail if they
are sent to an older receiver.

The first part of this fix was ported to Grizzly in Ib52e9458a to allow
receiving messages from Havana using the new format. Even though this
change will modify the message format, it will only do it when messages
are longer than 65K which would be broken anyway and could cause serious
bugs like the one linked below.

Fixes bug #1215091 (CVE-2013-4261)

Change-Id: I2f0e88435748bab631d969573d3a598d9e1f7fef

commit_message:
Fix problem when sending long messages in Qpid

Qpid has a limitation where it cannot serialize a dict containing a
string greater than 65535 characters. This change alters the Qpid
implementation to JSON encode the dict before sending it, but only if
Qpid would fail to serialize it. This maintains as much backward
compatibility as possible, though long messages will still fail if they
are sent to an older receiver.

The first part of this fix was ported to Grizzly in I8b6c5734b to allow
receiving messages from Havana using the new format. Even though this
change will modify the message format, it will only do it when messages
are longer than 65K which would be broken anyway and could cause serious
bugs like the one linked below.

Fixes bug 1215091

Change-Id: I2f0e88435748bab631d969573d3a598d9e1f7fef

commit_message:
New syntax to boot from a block device mapping

Add new arguments and syntax for booting from a block device mapping
that use the new os-block-device-mapping-v2-boot extension. These
allow to:

 * boot from an image, volume or snapshot (--image, --boot-volume, --snapshot)
 * attach any type of block device (--block-device).
 * attach an swap disk on boot (--swap).
 * attach an ephemeral disk on boot (--ephemeral).

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1aadeafed82b3bd1febcf0d1c3e64b258d6abeda

Nova support for vmware cinder driver

Part of blueprint vmware-nova-cinder-support

This is the first part of the blueprint that deals with attachment
and detachment of volumes.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-04 19:12:35.000000000', 'message': 'vmwareapi: remove a useless loop

This code included a while True loop that did nothing.  The code paths
inside of the loop could only return or raise an exception.  This patch
removes the loop.  There should be no functional changes here.

Change-Id: Id86874416453a8c5a597cbf17a639902c0311c6f
'}]
commit_message:
vmwareapi: remove a useless loop

This code included a while True loop that did nothing.  The code paths
inside of the loop could only return or raise an exception.  This patch
removes the loop.  There should be no functional changes here.

Change-Id: Id86874416453a8c5a597cbf17a639902c0311c6f

commit_message:
Add query support to alarm history API

Allow alarm history retrieval to be constrained by
user, project, change type or timestamp.

Partially implements bp alarm-audit-api

Change-Id: Iba303b422a2893ed63375c79d9dc4b93711cf215

commit_message:
Combine multiple exceptions into a linked one

When multiple tasks running at the same time
throw exceptions previously we would not be
able to rethrow all the combined ones which
was suboptimal. Instead of doing that create
a combined linked exception that can retain
all of the exceptions that were thrown and
rethrow that in the situation where more than
one task fails.

Change-Id: I8f882e0d58caa189d6bff2e33b0bc30c4cee553d

commit_message:
Fix a gross duplication of context code in objects tests

Because of the way we dual-inherit classes to get the local
and remote testing of objects, laziness caused us to duplicate
the code to get a context object all over the place. This
patch cleans that up.

Change-Id: I9b65968781afbecd0db72073299c019f8cc10241

commit_message:
Make compute_api use Aggregate objects

This makes the compute_api's AggregateAPI use the new Aggregate
object for its work.

Related to blueprint compute-api-objects

Change-Id: I97419bfe6c605306bd64f9aa4fce9657509df260

commit_message:
Enable the scaling up of nodes in a cluster

Enabled the ability to add nodes to a cluster.  The ability to delete
nodes will be added in a future commit once Ambari supports the
deletion of hosts from a cluster.

Fixes: bug #1216088

Conflicts:
	savanna/plugins/hdp/ambariplugin.py
	savanna/plugins/hdp/hadoopserver.py

Change-Id: I5bd5bf1b55412fbebbc5d9eb84cccc57e4b1824c
(cherry picked from commit f2ef149aac5568c2b41f8206cfd467984ba32198)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-04 16:28:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix KEK generation in the P11 Plugin + fix unit tests

Buckle up, this is going to be a long commit msg.

Background:
* Henry Yamauchi noted that the bind_kek_metadata method was returning
  an object early. This return prevented the entirety of the code that
  created the KEK on the HSM from executing
* This was not caught because the mock tests that checked for invocation
  of the method were wrong. Specifically they called methods like
  assert_called_once() and assert_called_twice(). Unfortunately, while
  assert_called_once_with(), et al are real methods on the mock objects
  that really do assert things, assert_called_once() is not. And when
  you call a method that doesn't exist on a mock object it returns
  another mock object. So many of these tests were testing nothing.
Fixes:
* bind_kek_metadata has been refactored to separate out the kek
  generation into a new method (_generate_kek) to make the expected flow
  clearer. And, of course, the bug has been fixed
* The tests have had all the incorrect assert calls removed. In some
  cases the call was actually unnecessary (typically because the test
  already used a return value from the mock so testing that it was
  called was not needed). In other cases an assert was added that
  checks that the called method on the mock object is true

Change-Id: I17a7adf7e3f386f3b0474e79731e7faab8911481
"}, {'created': '2013-09-04 18:13:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix KEK generation in the P11 Plugin + fix unit tests

Buckle up, this is going to be a long commit msg.

Background:
* Henry Yamauchi noted that the bind_kek_metadata method was returning
  an object early. This return prevented the entirety of the code that
  created the KEK on the HSM from executing
* This was not caught because the mock tests that checked for invocation
  of the method were wrong. Specifically they called methods like
  assert_called_once() and assert_called_twice(). Unfortunately, while
  assert_called_once_with(), et al are real methods on the mock objects
  that really do assert things, assert_called_once() is not. And when
  you call a method that doesn't exist on a mock object it returns
  another mock object. So many of these tests were testing nothing.
Fixes:
* bind_kek_metadata has been refactored to separate out the kek
  generation into a new method (_generate_kek) to make the expected flow
  clearer. And, of course, the bug has been fixed
* The tests have had all the incorrect assert calls removed. In some
  cases the call was actually unnecessary (typically because the test
  already used a return value from the mock so testing that it was
  called was not needed). In other cases an assert was added that
  checks that the called method on the mock object is true

Change-Id: I17a7adf7e3f386f3b0474e79731e7faab8911481
"}]
commit_message:
Fix KEK generation in the P11 Plugin + fix unit tests

Buckle up, this is going to be a long commit msg.

Background:
* Henry Yamauchi noted that the bind_kek_metadata method was returning
  an object early. This return prevented the entirety of the code that
  created the KEK on the HSM from executing
* This was not caught because the mock tests that checked for invocation
  of the method were wrong. Specifically they called methods like
  assert_called_once() and assert_called_twice(). Unfortunately, while
  assert_called_once_with(), et al are real methods on the mock objects
  that really do assert things, assert_called_once() is not. And when
  you call a method that doesn't exist on a mock object it returns
  another mock object. So many of these tests were testing nothing.
Fixes:
* bind_kek_metadata has been refactored to separate out the kek
  generation into a new method (_generate_kek) to make the expected flow
  clearer. And, of course, the bug has been fixed
* The tests have had all the incorrect assert calls removed. In some
  cases the call was actually unnecessary (typically because the test
  already used a return value from the mock so testing that it was
  called was not needed). In other cases an assert was added that
  checks that the called method on the mock object is true

Change-Id: I17a7adf7e3f386f3b0474e79731e7faab8911481

[{'created': '2013-09-03 22:17:14.000000000', 'message': 'Updates oslo-incubator files

Updates the openstack/common modules to the latest available version.
This is required to fix an issue in starting services on Windows.

Fixes bug: #1217043

Change-Id: If530cdf8609655ef55aabbad95a2ec8b44ed8679
'}, {'created': '2013-09-04 10:43:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes service startup issue on Windows

A recent addition in Oslo to support SIGHUP created a blocking issue
on Windows due to missing signal.SIGHUP support.

Fixes bug: #1217043

Change-Id: If530cdf8609655ef55aabbad95a2ec8b44ed8679
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes service startup issue on Windows

A recent addition in Oslo to support SIGHUP created a blocking issue
on Windows due to missing signal.SIGHUP support.

Fixes bug: #1217043

Change-Id: If530cdf8609655ef55aabbad95a2ec8b44ed8679

commit_message:
MultiThreaded engine and parallel action

MultiThreaded engine was implemented to execute tasks in parallel:
- added parallel action that executes and reverts tasks in parallel;
- added thread-safe storage.

Change-Id: I4a1f78c95ae5d38660bd32ce21d2b3fb1b2af8ad

commit_message:
Remove spaces from translatable strings

This patchset removes some unnesessary spaces form strings
in load balancers details pages that will be localized.

Fixes bug 1220686

Change-Id: I216394028876045ba29b5b7cc75ca2495c4a855c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-04 12:41:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use Python 3.x compatible except construct.

Python 3.x deprecated the form "except x,y:". Switch usage to
"except x as y:", which works with any Python version >= 2.6

Change-Id: Id276fdaee9e8753568227e638408e5bccff28e67
'}]
commit_message:
Use Python 3.x compatible except construct.

Python 3.x deprecated the form "except x,y:". Switch usage to
"except x as y:", which works with any Python version >= 2.6

Change-Id: Id276fdaee9e8753568227e638408e5bccff28e67

commit_message:
Add my_ip option in cinder.conf

Then cinder installed in multinode environment with more than one interface,
it's better to use CINDER_SERVICE_HOST option for cinder ip address.

Change-Id: I775b70407379d9c97696f536f5f89cecb33657be

[{'created': '2013-09-04 12:55:37.000000000', 'message': 'State management for engines

All state management moved to storage, including flow (engine) state,
task states, task results and failures.

Notifications for state changes were added.

Storage is now implemented using taskflow.persistence and enhanced with
means for result mapping and fetching task result by name.

Partially implements blueprint patterns-and-engines.

Co-authored-by: Anastasia Karpinska <akarpinska at griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Ia4e5707687096c948bd8db4f3d8936bdac40dd6c
'}]
commit_message:
State management for engines

All state management moved to storage, including flow (engine) state,
task states, task results and failures.

Notifications for state changes were added.

Storage is now implemented using taskflow.persistence and enhanced with
means for result mapping and fetching task result by name.

Partially implements blueprint patterns-and-engines.

Co-authored-by: Anastasia Karpinska <akarpinska at griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Ia4e5707687096c948bd8db4f3d8936bdac40dd6c

commit_message:
xenapi: README.md and embedded localrc updates

This change updates the readme, so that it is easier to get started, and
reflects the actual behavior of DevStack.

Changes in README.md:
 - Link to xenserver download page
 - Remove neutron interface - it is no longer installed by devstack
 - Add appendix with
   - How to use a different ubuntu mirror
   - How to use a proxy for ubuntu
   - How to re-use the created VM
 - Remove run from snapshot section and "do cloudy stuff"

Changes in the Readme-embedded sample localrc:
 - Upload a vhd image and a uec image by default - easier to get started

Change-Id: I13bb8e59ff5367ff7623fe9aa273886a957f81a7

commit_message:
xenapi: Set VM memory before starting it

If someone was re-using an existing template, for a memory change, he
needed to re-install the vm. This change sets the osdomu mem before
starting it, so it doesn't matter how much memory did the VM had
according to the template. It also removes the memory manipulation bits
from install-os-vpx.sh.

Change-Id: Iad85f573b90c23140012c20c552a17277d9c97a0

open-iscsi-utils has been deprecated on Ubuntu since Quantal.  Please use the correct package name on later distros.  See files/apts/n-cpu."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2013-09-03 20:00:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The problem with using the open-iscsi package, is that for folks running 12.04, which there are a lot, then they won't actually get iscsiadm.  The open-iscsi-utils has a dependency on open-iscsi.  So using open-iscsi-utils will work for folks older than 12.10."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-09-03 20:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Look in files/apts/n-cpu.  precise and older use open-iscsi-utils, everything uses open-iscsi.  I want to reflect reality and not rely on a transitional dummy package that is likely to vanish in/after the next Ubuntu LTS release.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2013-09-03 20:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-03 20:56:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-08-30 19:41:27.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder needs iscsiadm available

This patch adds the binary packages that contains

commit_message:
Cinder needs iscsiadm available

This patch adds the binary packages that contains
the iscsiadm utility for cinder.   Cinder
uses the iscsiadm utility for various actions
and it should be there for devstack users.

Fixes bug #1219032

Change-Id: I8e1c6e2e5d4bfade50aba9259b6da3957d6d622d

commit_message:
xenapi: add username to vncviewer command

Devstack prints out an instruction, how to look at the virtual machine's
console. The command did not include the username, so if the user had a
config file to use a different username for that network, the command
failed.

Change-Id: I5dd49169c45e26e8d2bb3d5920a1b7fa584be50f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-24 18:40:08.000000000', 'message': 'support API message localization

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils,
it is possible to use the Accept-Language header to translate
and exception message to the user requested locale and return
that translation from the API.

This is a rough implementation of such a design.

Co-authored-by: Ben Nemec <bnemec@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I446fdf4b9843155e0c818c271114b1e2e4f43b64

commit_message:
Add support for API message localization

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils,
it is possible to use the Accept-Language header to translate
an exception message to the user requested locale and return
that translation from the API.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: I446fdf4b9843155e0c818c271114b1e2e4f43b64

commit_message:
Libvirt: call capabilites before getVersion()

Updates the Nova libvirt driver so we make a call to get
the driver capabilities. This is clearly a work around
but it does allow nova-compute to startup cleanly when
performing a clean install of Fedora 19.

See notes in: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1000116

Fixes LP Bug #1215593.

Change-Id: I2c74dc001032e3cc4d7d55a3fa407b96fd0d0e78

commit_message:
Fix virtual power driver fails silently

This patch changes the behavior of Virtual Power driver. VPD will
now raise an exception should the mac address for the node not
be found. It will also log the node name and mac address.

fixes bug 1201964
Change-Id: I04a275cf8d2cc7665720329000fbe087aa636b21

commit_message:
Add jump to float-snat chain after clearing snat chain

Clearing the chain in this code eliminates the rule to jump to the
floating-snat chain.  This is the simplest way to get it working
again.

Change-Id: Ic1818e10bd64170b6f0a2f52af8dc0814d7e04e0
Fixes: Bug #1218040

I've got 2 concerns with this proposal:

1) Cheetah.  We should not be writing new code to use this library.  I'd prefer us to us Mako.  (Note: LBaaS templating will benefit from this change too.)

2) I'm not sure why we need the netns wrapper.  dnsmasq is able to run with namespace without all of the extra support."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-15 05:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: (1 inline comment)

Hi Mark

1) Cheetah. We should not be writing new code to use this library. I'd prefer us to us Mako. (Note: LBaaS templating will benefit from this change too.)
-> gotcha I'll use Mako.

2) I'm not sure why we need the netns wrapper. dnsmasq is able to run with namespace without all of the extra support.

yeah, dnsmaq is OK because it will get config on command line. However strongswan reads conf from fixed place (/etc), this is why wrapper is needed."}, {'account_id': 6659, 'date': '2013-07-15 19:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: (2 inline comments)

During the test, I noticed the following concerns. The first is important.
I failed to run this patch on Ubuntu 12.04: http://paste.openstack.org/show/40655/

- This patch seems to require Linux kernel with 3.8+ version. It means this implementation does not work on Ubuntu 12.04 LTS.
  mount namespace is supported since Linux 2.4.19 so I am not sure why we need such new kernel is required.
- This patch introduces namespace-wrapper but the error messages from namespace-wrapper will gone somewhere. It makes difficult to debug.

I will continue to test after I prepare Ubuntu 13.04 environments."}, {'account_id': 6659, 'date': '2013-07-17 14:14:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: (1 inline comment)

Thanks Nachi!
I confirmed VPN works between two devstack as described in VPNaaS wiki on Ubuntu 12.04.

I think it is ready to merge except the following.  If you can fix it soon, it is better to fix in this patch. What do you think?

The CRITICAL log message I commented in the last patch set should not be output (even though it is an expected behavior). Most operators usually watch logs with ERROR or higher levels to detect alerts. It can be improved in the future patch. If so please file a bug.

I would like to clarify it before giving +2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-17 16:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

[one more question] netns-wrapper is acceptable as long as a solution to use the current implementation of strongswan. "}, {'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements ipsec-vpn-reference

This patch implements reference driver implementation
for VPNaaS.
The driver uses strongswan to manage vpn connections

Future work:
  VPN connection status update by actual status
  Support ikepolicy and ipsec update
  Support multiple driver

This patch introduces quantum-vpn-nswrap command.
Strongswan that will be used for this first implementation can't
be launched several times in the same host "as is", because its
configuration, pid and control socket files location are hard coded.

As Strongswan will be launched in a network namespace using "ip netns"
command, it will also run in a mount namespace created by this command.

The solution consists in using a wrapper that bind-mount the required
directories in a speratate folder, this mount will only affect the subprocess
launched by the wrapper.

This wrapper also enforces rootwrap filter validation to make sure it can't
be used to run unauthorized commands as root

The wrapper can be launched as follow:
sudo /usr/local/bin/quantum-rootwrap /etc/quantum/rootwrap.conf \
ip netns exec test_ns quantum-netns-wrapper -d \
--cmd "ipsec, start" \
--mount_paths /etc,/var/run \
--mount_prefix /opt/stack/data/quantum/ipsec/ \
--rootwrap_config /etc/quantum/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I8c5ed800a71ca014dc7bdbb6a57c4f8d18fa82e0

- This patch will add Cheetah for dependencies.
Cheetah is template library used for generating config file.
This is same way as Nova doing.

- This patch introduces neutron-netns-wrapper command.
Strongswan that will be used for this first implementation can't
be launched several times in the same host "as is", because its
configuration, pid and control socket files location are hard coded.

As Strongswan will be launched in a network namespace using "ip netns"
command, it will also run in a mount namespace created by this command.

The solution consists in using a wrapper that bind-mount the required
directories in a speratate folder, this mount will only affect the subprocess
launched by the wrapper.

This wrapper also enforces rootwrap filter validation to make sure it can't
be used to run unauthorized commands as root

The wrapper can be launched as follow:
sudo /usr/local/bin/neutron-rootwrap /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf \
ip netns exec test_ns neutron-netns-wrapper -d \
--cmd "ipsec,start" \
--mount_paths /etc:/some_dir/etc,/var/run:/some_dir/var/run \
--rootwrap_config /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I8c5ed800a71ca014dc7bdbb6a57c4f8d18fa82e0

'}, {'created': '2013-07-17 17:38:38.000000000', 'message': 'Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

This patch implements reference driver implementation for VPNaaS.
The driver uses strongswan to manage vpn connections.

Future work:
VPN connection status update by actual status
Support ikepolicy and ipsec update
Support multiple driver
Support service type framework

This patch will add Jinja2 for dependencies. Jinja2 is a template library
used to generate strongswan config files.

This patch introduces neutron-netns-wrapper command.
- Multiple instances of Strongswan cannot be launched in the same host "as is",
  because the locations of its configuration,  pid and control socket file
  are hard coded.
  In addition,  since Strongswan will be launched in a network namespace
  using "ip netns" command,  it needs to run in a mount namespace created
  by this command.
- The solution is to use a wrapper that bind-mount the required directories
  in a separate folder. This mount will only affect the subprocess launched
  by the wrapper.
- This wrapper also enforces rootwrap filter validation to make sure it can't
  be used to run unauthorized commands as root.
- The wrapper can be launched as follow:

ip netns exec test_ns neutron-netns-wrapper -d \
  --cmd "ipsec,start" \
  --mount_paths /etc:/some_dir/etc,/var/run:/some_dir/var/run \
  --rootwrap_config /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I8c5ed800a71ca014dc7bdbb6a57c4f8d18fa82e0
'}, {'created': '2013-07-19 08:57:51.000000000', 'message': 'Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

This patch implements reference driver implementation for VPNaaS.
The driver uses strongswan to manage vpn connections.

Future work:
VPN connection status update by actual status
Support ikepolicy and ipsec update
Support multiple driver
Support service type framework

This patch will add Jinja2 for dependencies. Jinja2 is a template library
used to generate strongswan config files.

This patch introduces neutron-netns-wrapper command.
- Multiple instances of Strongswan cannot be launched in the same host "as is",
  because the locations of its configuration,  pid and control socket file
  are hard coded.
  In addition,  since Strongswan will be launched in a network namespace
  using "ip netns" command,  it needs to run in a mount namespace created
  by this command.
- The solution is to use a wrapper that bind-mount the required directories
  in a separate folder. This mount will only affect the subprocess launched
  by the wrapper.
- This wrapper also enforces rootwrap filter validation to make sure it can't
  be used to run unauthorized commands as root.
- The wrapper can be launched as follow:

ip netns exec test_ns neutron-netns-wrapper -d \
  --cmd "ipsec,start" \
  --mount_paths /etc:/some_dir/etc,/var/run:/some_dir/var/run \
  --rootwrap_config /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I8c5ed800a71ca014dc7bdbb6a57c4f8d18fa82e0

used to generate strongswan config files.

This patch introduces neutron-netns-wrapper command.
- Multiple instances of Strongswan cannot be launched in the same host "as is",
  because the locations of its configuration,  pid and control socket file
  are hard coded.
  In addition,  since Strongswan will be launched in a network namespace
  using "ip netns" command,  it needs to run in a mount namespace created
  by this command.
- The solution is to use a wrapper that bind-mount the required directories
  in a separate folder. This mount will only affect the subprocess launched
  by the wrapper.
- This wrapper also enforces rootwrap filter validation to make sure it can't
  be used to run unauthorized commands as root.
- The wrapper can be launched as follow:

ip netns exec test_ns neutron-netns-wrapper -d \
  --cmd "ipsec,start" \
  --mount_paths /etc:/some_dir/etc,/var/run:/some_dir/var/run \
  --rootwrap_config /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I8c5ed800a71ca014dc7bdbb6a57c4f8d18fa82e0

  be used to run unauthorized commands as root.
- The wrapper can be launched as follow:

ip netns exec test_ns neutron-netns-wrapper -d \
  --cmd "ipsec,start" \
  --mount_paths /etc:/some_dir/etc,/var/run:/some_dir/var/run \
  --rootwrap_config /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I8c5ed800a71ca014dc7bdbb6a57c4f8d18fa82e0
'}, {'created': '2013-08-22 20:00:14.000000000', 'message': 'Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

This patch implements reference driver implementation for VPNaaS.
The driver uses strongswan to manage vpn connections.

Future work:
IPSec Site connection status update by actual status
Support ikepolicy and ipsec update
Support multiple driver
Support service type framework
Intelligent updating of resources

This patch will add Jinja2 for dependencies. Jinja2 is a template library
used to generate strongswan config files.

This patch introduces neutron-netns-wrapper command.
- Multiple instances of Strongswan cannot be launched in the same host "as is",
  because the locations of its configuration,  pid and control socket file
  are hard coded.
  In addition,  since Strongswan will be launched in a network namespace
  using "ip netns" command,  it needs to run in a mount namespace created
  by this command.
- The solution is to use a wrapper that bind-mount the required directories
  in a separate folder. This mount will only affect the subprocess launched
  by the wrapper.
- This wrapper also enforces rootwrap filter validation to make sure it can't
  be used to run unauthorized commands as root.
- The wrapper can be launched as follow:

ip netns exec test_ns neutron-netns-wrapper -d \
  --cmd "ipsec,start" \
  --mount_paths /etc:/some_dir/etc,/var/run:/some_dir/var/run \
  --rootwrap_config /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf

Change-Id: I8c5ed800a71ca014dc7bdbb6a57c4f8d18fa82e0

commit_message:
Reference driver implementation (IPsec) for VPNaaS

Implements blueprint ipsec-vpn-reference

This patch implements reference driver implementation for VPNaaS.
The driver uses openswan to manage vpn connections.

Future work: Support ikepolicy and ipsec update
Support service type framework
Intelligent updating of resources

This commit adds jinja2 for requirements.txt for
generating cofig file.

Change-Id: I8c5ed800a71ca014dc7bdbb6a57c4f8d18fa82e0

subject: Embrane Neutron Plugin
