messages:
[{'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-02 13:48:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Ivar,

I am looking, even if slowly, at this code.
It is organized fairly well, and it is not hard to read.
However 6045 lines are really much more than what a couple of reviewers can chew.

Have you thought about any possible strategy for splitting this patch into 3-4 patches, either independent or stacked?

Also there is still an open question regarding whether this plugin should be implemented as you're doing now or rely on https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/quantum-l3-routing-plugin

I have not heard in a while for this patch, but was rated high in the early havana release cycle, so we should still aim at merging it."}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-02 14:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Salvatore,

Thank you for your review. 
After a talk with Sumit (who had your same concern about patch size), I was already thinking how to reduce the patch size dramatically so that it can be reviewed easier and sooner.

As you can see most of the code is backend specific, which I want to share just because that's the spirit of an Opensource project :)
However, for now, in order to cut the code and keep full functionality, I could remove from the patch the backend specific code, and distribute it separately.
This would work at least at first, and then I'll slowly integrate everything back in order to give you small patches  and plenty of time to review it.

As far as the router service blueprint is concerned, I totally agree with that kind of implementation, maybe we can review/merge the Embrane plugin as is for now, and when the latter is implemented I'll move it to that paradigm.

How does it sound?

Thanks,
Ivar."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-03 22:22:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For backend specific code, it is really up to you whether you decide to keep in the neutron plugin or distribute it separately, there is no preference about that.

Of course we would be reviewing much less code, which is ok.
I don't want to put integration with the l3-routing-plugin blueprint as a requirement at the moment - so feel free to update this patch stripping down all the proprietary that are not necessary to neutron."}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-05 21:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-05 22:12:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

Thank you for your review, I've corrected most of the things you reported and added some comments to others. I'll upload the patch soon."}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-06 00:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-06 00:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-full/46ac71f : FAILURE in 42m 53s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-08-06 00:50:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Needs unit tests."}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-08-06 17:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I believe Ivar is working on the unit tests but had to rework things when he drastically cut down the size of the patch. This patch was meant to be work-in-progress until then.

Ivar, can you mark this patch as WIP until you have the unit tests back in the patch?

Also, it will be good to provide a README file at the top level of your plugin directory structure (you can check with the other plugins on what to put in it).'}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-06 17:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

implementing unit tests'}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-06 22:26:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-06 23:17:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/5/check/gate-neutron-pep8/9efaf8c : SUCCESS in 2m 03s

- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/5/check/gate-neutron-python26/3f591a0 : FAILURE in 13m 55s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/5/check/gate-neutron-python27/b9a9b10 : FAILURE in 9m 07s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/ff639ae : SUCCESS in 17m 03s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-full/8bd5130 : FAILURE in 50m 16s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-08-07 01:59:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Per Salvatore's initial review, I think this patch would be really great once we land Bob's L3 routing plugin patch [1]. Until that happens, this only works with OVS. And with ML2 being the recommended way forward in Havana (and OVS being deprecated in Icehouse), I think this patch should support ML2 at a minimum.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/quantum-l3-routing-plugin"}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-07 02:14:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Kyle,

I completely agree with your comment, however, since ML2 allows to simultaneously utilize multiple L2 plugins, Embrane's L3 plugin in order to work properly must be able to access network specific information for each one of the ML2's supported L2 technologies.  
For this reason, I would like to think deeply about the best way of integrating them, and I think the ML2 support should be addressed soon but in a different changeset.
I will start working on that in parallel with this patch."}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-08-07 02:59:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I tend to agree with Ivar here. The Embrane plugin is using a configurable approach towards leveraging a L2 plugin. So it should be possible to extend support to the ML2 plugin in a separate follow up patch.

There are other plugins which are currently leveraging the OVS plugin and I don't see any plans to change that in the H time frame."}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-08-07 03:17:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Sumit and Ivar: Apologies if I came off as harsh here, I only meant to point out that adding support for ML2 would be a good goal to have, particularly in Icehouse. Since this doesn't actually extend features into the OVS plugin but merely builds on top of it, I don't think there's anything wrong with the OVS support here."}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-07 10:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

That will be great indeed! This is going to be one of my first priorities after this patch is done (so I have an approved base to start working on).

Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-07 20:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-07 21:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/6/check/gate-neutron-pep8/ce643a0 : SUCCESS in 1m 59s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/22/38222/6/check/gate-neutron-docs/1b5705b/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 27s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/6/check/gate-neutron-python26/3418824 : SUCCESS in 29m 21s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/6/check/gate-neutron-python27/8ce9553 : SUCCESS in 18m 46s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/80f7cc3 : SUCCESS in 20m 00s
- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron-full/d974729 : FAILURE in 43m 06s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-08-09 18:54:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Need to do a detailed review of the code, but wanted to comment on the issue of declaring a type at module load from runtime configuration values.  It is not a good idea because of the inherit race of module load and configuration reading (the order is not guaranteed). Another approach should be taken thats accounts for the fact that the plugin to load isn't 100% assures until the manager instantiates it."}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-09 19:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi Mark, Thanks for your review.
So you say that the moment the Manager loads the plugin class the configuration files reading could be incomplete due to race condition? And therefore my config parameter "l2_plugin" could not be there?

If so, when can I assume to be certain that all the configuration files have been red?'}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-11 15:23:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (5 inline comments)

Based on Mark's comment, I've moved the plugin type declaration at the time the plugin is instantiated (it was at module load before)."}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-11 15:24:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-11 16:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22/38222/7/check/gate-neutron-pep8/1456d4f : SUCCESS in 1m 58s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/22/38222/7/check/gate-neutron-docs/d08b6d0/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 34s

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-08-14 02:02:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(17 inline comments)

Ok there are several things that jump out.  

1) The proposal uses native threads while the Neutron server will be greenthreads via eventlet.  Mixing thread types is a bad idea and will cause many hard to diagnose problems.

2) Parts of the code don't feel very pythonic.  The extensive use of properties is probably is the biggest item.  Most of the use cases for properties should be plain attribute access."}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-14 05:53:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-14 05:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Adjustments made following Mark's advice.
greenthread is now used instead of threading.

As for the ML2 support, there was a little discussion some comments above with Kyle, in which I explain that it's absolutely a good idea to have this support, but I'll track it on a different blueprint once this one is approved (I'll probably need a little bit of time for that, so the support will be proposed in the "I" release).'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-14 06:47:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-08-22 03:50:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

Minor code clean up in the inline comments.  

My biggest concern is the amount of magic in building the plugin class.  There's over 100 lines of code that deal with accomplishing a task dynamically that can covered <10 lines of code statically.  This part of the proposal runs counter to the Zen of Python.

class OVSEmbrane(EmbrainPlugin, L2OVSSupport, OVSPlugin):
   def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
       super(OVSEmbrane, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
       self._after_init_hook()  # this would do the Embrane specific init.


You can provide ones you think are likely to most used and provide a recipe for the deployer to write their own 10 lines class if there is a combination you did not consider.  This also has the benefit of showing the set of the known working configurations."}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-23 01:37:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-23 01:41:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 7987, 'date': '2013-08-23 01:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-23 03:07:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Works for me

route and extratoute extensions.

supports are to come if the model is approved (or a different one
is suggested).

commit_message:
Embrane Neutron Plugin

Implements blueprint embrane-neutron-plugin

This commit implements the main Embrane plugin, which covers
route and extratoute extensions.

The plugin will rely on existing plugins for leveraging L2 networks,
for now it only supports OpenVSwitch and vlan networks, but more
supports are to come if the model is approved (or a different one
is suggested).

Change-Id: I90aff8ec4324bd3a7c59c411374db6a118d1a72b

One question for the specs.
Are you going to support service framework support when router supports service framework?

How this patch is related with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20693/?'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-30 14:55:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (6 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-08-30 15:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Nachi,

About the service type framework, at first I had a plan to implement this feature on top of the service type framework, but there is a discussion about what we should do when a corresponding provider disappears by configuration change or dynamic configuration. So I decided to implement this BP without depending on it.

Regarding L3 routing service plugin, it is not related directly. Of course I can support it in the future, but this is implemented as monolisic plugin (similar to NVP plugin). As far as I understand, L3 routing service plugin is a refactoring of L3 extension and it does not support multiple service providers at now. In this patch, I would like to support two types of routers at the same time.

I hope we have a support L3 service plugin with the service type framework in early IceHouse.'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-08-30 16:49:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Akihiro

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-24 07:01:44.000000000', 'message': 'OpenFlow distributed router support in NEC plugin

Implements bp/nec-distribute-router

This commit makes L3 agent notifiers configurable.
l3-agent router and OpenFlow distributed router can coexist.
Notication to l3-agent should be done only when routers are
hosted by l3-agent, so we need custom L3 agent notifiers
to filter non l3-agent routers.

Change-Id: I538201742950a61b92fb05c49a9256bc96ae9014
'}, {'created': '2013-08-24 07:16:54.000000000', 'message': 'OpenFlow distributed router support in NEC plugin

Implements bp/nec-distribute-router

This commit makes L3 agent notifiers configurable.
l3-agent router and OpenFlow distributed router can coexist.
Notication to l3-agent should be done only when routers are
hosted by l3-agent, so we need custom L3 agent notifiers
to filter non l3-agent routers.

Change-Id: I538201742950a61b92fb05c49a9256bc96ae9014
'}, {'created': '2013-08-30 18:32:34.000000000', 'message': 'OpenFlow distributed router support in NEC plugin

Implements blueprint nec-distribute-router

Two types of neutron router will be supported: l3-agent and distributed.
A type can be specified through "provider" attribute of a router.
The naming of the attribute "provider" is intentional since I plan to
support the service provider framework for router in the future and
would like to make it easy to migrate.

distributed router in NEC OpenFLow controller now does not support NAT,
so l3-agent and distributed router coexists. To achieve it, l3-agent
scheudler logic is modified in NEC plugin to exclude distributed routers
from candidates of floating IP hosting routers.

To support the above feature, the following related changes are done:
- Adds a new driver to PFC driver which supports OpenFlow based router
  support in NEC OpenFlow products in PFlow v5.
- Update ofc_client to extract detail error message
  from OpenFlow controller

This commit also changes the following outside of NEC plugin:
- Makes L3 agent notifiers configurable.
  l3-agent router and OpenFlow distributed router can coexist.
  Notication to l3-agent should be done only when routers are

commit_message:
OpenFlow distributed router support in NEC plugin

Implements blueprint nec-distribute-router

Two types of neutron router will be supported: l3-agent and distributed.
A type can be specified through "provider" attribute of a router.
The naming of the attribute "provider" is intentional since I plan to
support the service provider framework for router in the future and
would like to make it easy to migrate.

distributed router in NEC OpenFLow controller now does not support NAT,
so l3-agent and distributed router coexists. To achieve it, l3-agent
scheudler logic is modified in NEC plugin to exclude distributed routers
from candidates of floating IP hosting routers.

To support the above feature, the following related changes are done:
- Adds a new driver to PFC driver which supports OpenFlow based router
  support in NEC OpenFlow products in PFlow v5.
- Update ofc_client to extract detail error message
  from OpenFlow controller

This commit also changes the following outside of NEC plugin:
- Makes L3 agent notifiers configurable.
  l3-agent router and OpenFlow distributed router can coexist.
  Notication to l3-agent should be done only when routers are
  hosted by l3-agent, so we need custom L3 agent notifiers
  to filter non l3-agent routers.
- Split test_agent_scheduler base class (in OVS plugin) into
  the base setup and testcases. By doing so we can implement
  custom testcases related to agent scheduler.

Change-Id: I538201742950a61b92fb05c49a9256bc96ae9014

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-02 17:25:35.000000000', 'message': 'Regarding to:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/install/yum/content/cinder-install.html

As mentioned in “Set up the cinder database.”, the “PRIVILEGES” giving to cinder are local. Therefore I think it’s important to emphasize that:
“Edit /etc/cinder/cinder.conf to reflect your settings.” will give permission to local host. Thus, instead of:
sql_connection = mysql://cinder:openstack@192.168.127.130/cinder
should be written:
sql_connection = mysql://cinder:openstack@localhost/cinder

try to fix Bug #1214764

Change-Id: I03f58f04f246a72f810492a7bf2e774e5b827921
'}, {'created': '2013-09-04 08:05:10.000000000', 'message': 'Use localhost connection for cinder

commit_message:
Use localhost connection for cinder

As mentioned in “Set up the cinder database.”, the “PRIVILEGES” giving to cinder are local. Therefore I think it’s important to emphasize that:
“Edit /etc/cinder/cinder.conf to reflect your settings.” will give permission to local host.

try to fix Bug #1214764

Change-Id: I03f58f04f246a72f810492a7bf2e774e5b827921

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 22:42:44.000000000', 'message': 'emit warning while running flake8 without virtual env

run_tests.sh -N -p
it will call the flake8 installed on your host to detect PEP8, and
the flake8 plugin "OpenStack hacking" may not installed on your
host, so this command may not detect the OpenStack Style Commandment
supplied by hacking(e.g H202).

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack
hacking" installed in virtual env will be triggered.

The result from "run_tests.sh -p" should be trusted, and jenkins uses
virtual env to run flake8 too.

When "-N" is enabled, emit warning to remind user.

Bug #1215405

Change-Id: Ic0fc8d39a87942e175256453c6c4347f6a5cfbba

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack

When "-N" is enabled, emit warning to stderr to remind user.

Bug #1215405

Change-Id: Ic0fc8d39a87942e175256453c6c4347f6a5cfbba
'}]
commit_message:
emit warning while running flake8 without virtual env

run_tests.sh -N -p
it will call the flake8 installed on your host to detect PEP8, and
the flake8 plugin "OpenStack hacking" may not installed on your
host, so this command may not detect the OpenStack Style Commandment
supplied by hacking(e.g H202).

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack
hacking" installed in virtual env will be triggered.

The result from "run_tests.sh -p" should be trusted, and jenkins uses
virtual env to run flake8 too.

When "-N" is enabled, emit warning to stderr to remind user.

Bug #1215405

Change-Id: Ic0fc8d39a87942e175256453c6c4347f6a5cfbba

commit_message:
Use unique disqus shortname

Do not use the OpenStack documentation disqus shortname but a project
unique one. A disqus project has been setup.

Change-Id: I0d173ac419bdabe64639130979ec8a9ab6c8679a
Partial-Bug: #1067208

commit_message:
Move the network api tests to smoke

Make the existing neutron tests voting.
However what should be smoke test, does not
have clear definition yet, but this change let these tests to vote.

Change-Id: I02612b3591057c4f59d6571e90acda74de802444

Closes-Bug: #1220521
Change-Id: Ic71b24c724222ade5e695addf291c6488d665da9
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes formatting exception from logging in BigSwitch plugin

Corrects the data type expected for the HTTP code that comes
back from the back-end controller in a debug log call.

Closes-Bug: #1220521
Change-Id: Ic71b24c724222ade5e695addf291c6488d665da9

commit_message:
uniforms skip messages

this is an attempt to uniform skip messages and ensure multi-line
skips are correctly accounted by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42424/
I think a future update to hacking/checks.py is also needed

commit_message:
Port flavormanage extension to v3 API Part 2

Ports the flavormanage extension and the corresponding
unittests to the v3 framework.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Iaf6b4a2d7f4e4993a6540e8a3afc774b7b158608

commit_message:
Switch heat template to use native nova resource

This change switches InstanceCfnInitTestJSON to use
the new resource type OS::Nova::Server instead of
AWS::EC2::Instance.

The next patch in this series will rename the file to refer to
"server" instead of "instance" as per nova's semantics

Change-Id: I1ae6460158a18517d430298602ad803fe1f8bb9f
Partial-Bug: #1187942

commit_message:
Add more detailed message about the volumes missing

Instead of just showing the ones that were missing,
show the ones that were expected, the list that was
retrieved and the difference in one message. This
makes it much easier to see what the failure was.

Change-Id: I3ecb39fd2347af265f72e072e4827946c10fb2f6

commit_message:
Add handling for inherited stress attributes

In some cases inheritance is used for test cases (like XML/JSON tests).
For many of those cases inherited stress attribute are misleading
since they will execute nearly the same load on the system.

To avoid this issue we skip all inherited stress attributes by default
and add parameters to deactivate this on a global level and function
level.

Change-Id: I4260844ed15917106436d836c939157e32a59554
Fixes: bug #1219402

commit_message:
Inherit base image properties on instance creation

When creating an instance, a few properties from the image will be saved
in the instance's system_metadata under the prefix 'image_' for latter
usage.

The keys that the instance will inherit from the image are: 'min_ram',
'min_disk', 'disk_format' and 'container_format' together with the
inheritable image properties.

Related to bug #1039662

Change-Id: I358fb6d8dcafd67c289fe5083bb82140f3759fee

commit_message:
Copy policy_add() from Grenade functions

policy_all() was added to Grenade's functions file, which is notmally synced
from DevStack so we need to bring it over here before the next sync.

[{'created': '2013-08-30 13:16:36.000000000', 'message': 'remove multi-host timeout

If you ran exercises with MULTI_HOST enabled, an additional sleep was
performed. This change removes that sleep to speed up tests.

Change-Id: I9dfd61cbb9415bd5e8fd1e40f4e41512be2ae0d2
'}]
commit_message:
remove multi-host timeout

If you ran exercises with MULTI_HOST enabled, an additional sleep was
performed. This change removes that sleep to speed up tests.

Change-Id: I9dfd61cbb9415bd5e8fd1e40f4e41512be2ae0d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-02 19:03:31.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Debian support in Basic Install Guide

The Guide is built for both Debian and Ubuntu and there are a few
places that are only relevant for either of these. These sections
have been updated to clarify for which OS they are.

Some places used "deb" instead of "debian" or missed to add os="debian",
these were fixed as well.

Note: The basic install guide is build with os="ubuntu;debian", so some
of these changes do not change the generated code.

Change-Id: Ib50c5cee239c370a17d5462c2a6837357242425d
Closes-Bug: #1206328
'}, {'created': '2013-09-04 06:48:19.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Debian support in Basic Install Guide

The Guide is built for both Debian and Ubuntu and there are a few
places that are only relevant for either of these. These sections
have been updated to clarify for which OS they are.

Some places used "deb" instead of "debian" or missed to add os="debian",
these were fixed as well.

Note: The basic install guide is build with os="ubuntu;debian", so some
of these changes do not change the generated code.

Change-Id: Ib50c5cee239c370a17d5462c2a6837357242425d
Closes-Bug: #1206328
'}]
commit_message:
Improve Debian support in Basic Install Guide

The Guide is built for both Debian and Ubuntu and there are a few
places that are only relevant for either of these. These sections
have been updated to clarify for which OS they are.

Some places used "deb" instead of "debian" or missed to add os="debian",
these were fixed as well.

Note: The basic install guide is build with os="ubuntu;debian", so some
of these changes do not change the generated code.

Change-Id: Ib50c5cee239c370a17d5462c2a6837357242425d
Closes-Bug: #1206328

commit_message:
Adds support for admin to create flavors through mgmt API

Extending the management API to allow for an admin to
create flavors categorized on service type in trove.

Implements: blueprint service-type-filter-on-flavors

Change-Id: I578b4f932d193c64634259f41447218006085a43

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-29 00:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-ceilometer-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/91/44191/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/14ba115 : SUCCESS in 3m 07s
- gate-ceilometer-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/91/44191/1/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/01401a8/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 7m 31s
- gate-ceilometer-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/91/44191/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/898fabc : SUCCESS in 12m 42s
- gate-ceilometer-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/91/44191/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/fe12c78 : SUCCESS in 5m 40s
'}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-08-29 13:07:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

This seems like a good way to avoid dupes. The name message_id doesn't make sense to me at the storage layer. The message_id uniquely identifies an event, so it seems like it should become the primary key in the event table, and should be renamed to event_id. Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-29 13:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-29 13:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

oh, and I think we should keep the event_id as the primary key, since the message_id is a string, it would get expensive in the join tables.'}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-08-29 13:44:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure all events are going to have a 'message_id'. IE, when we start synthesizing events from the pipeline (can't wait!), those won't have message ids, will they? If alarms ever start generating events, will they have message ids? I think it's too coupled to the notification pipeline. Logically, the 'message_id' is really the primary key for this table - it's what the API will be using to query events given an event id - so I think it should be called event_id. String joins is a good reason to keep around an int primary key.

Maybe I'm being too particular. I don't know :)"}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-29 14:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If the event is using the olso notification library (which it should) it will have a message_id attached to it. The library will take care of that. If not, it's just a uuid, so it's easy enough to generate.

I would hope that something like an alarm event would have a message_id associated with it. It's just as important as something like "compute.instance.run_instance". 

But your point is valid, the api should be using the message_id as the parameter into events. I'm just worried that there will be confusion about event.id vs. event_id'}, {'account_id': 5678, 'date': '2013-08-29 16:59:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not convinced event.id vs event_id will be overly confusing. event.id is a sqlalchemy implementation detail."}, {'account_id': 688, 'date': '2013-08-29 21:49:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-29 22:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Reject duplicate events

When ack_on_error=False, there is a possibility that we
could receieve the same message more than once. Reject those events.

Change-Id: I3814a4222298d2fbc56a25e6e4540d01066ee42f

commit_message:
xenapi: Increase default OS domU memory to 2G

In XenServer scenarios, an additional domU is created to run OpenStack
services. This change is increasing the memory for that VM to speed up
test runs.

Change-Id: I322f4e4703e506620fa7e7456c4264ee0d050edc

commit_message:
Adds metrics collection support in Hyper-V

Blueprint: hyper-v-metrics

Hyper-V Server 2012 supports a new set of metrics API that can be used
to provide instance metrics data to external applications, e.g.
Ceilometer.

Metrics collection is disabled by default and can be enabled with a
config option.

Change-Id: I3523888c6bdd22f488c273c9e3eea1083a479700

@Brian, you're right! I'll correct this by waiting the first metering_measure_interval loop before to calculate the delta. Thoughts ?"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2013-08-08 15:55:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

@Sylvain - regarding calculating deltas

This can be fixed by using 'iptables -Z...' in get_traffic_counters() in your other changeset, which would then always enforce deltas since the last read.  That might impact your 'total_bytes' fields (are those necessary?).

I'm not sure what you could do with get_traffic_counters_by_target() though, but it seems to not be called?"}, {'account_id': 7141, 'date': '2013-08-12 09:32:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-12 10:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Works for me

commit_message:
Add Neutron l3 metering agent

This is the agent side of :
blueprint bandwidth-router-measurement
blueprint bandwidth-router-label

This patch initiates agent side by adding a new
l3 metering agent and a Noop Driver.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib34721209c282b2669ff5488a33293d9f86467ef

commit_message:
Move muranodashboard logs to a separate file.

Default file location is /var/log/murano-dashboard.log
(hard-coded into horizon config, still have to make it
more flexible). In this separate file we have the same
log levels which were specified in code (contrary to
ubiquitous [error] in apache logs).

Fixes: bug MRN-745.

Change-Id: Id4977b40cebba7e1fada055443c6c26ab64d9584

commit_message:
alarm api: rename counter_name to meter_name

We already have a really poor naming convention the metering API, and we
decided to remove the counter term from everywhere. We can't fix the
metering API since we relesed it, so let's fix the alarming one before
it gets released and we have to handle a lot of complicated
compatibility. :-(

Change-Id: I3e3219d2eae0b72ad4a898630cacfd334e9390cc

commit_message:
Update nested stacks in parallel

This parallelises updates for AWS::CloudFormation::Stack resources, but not
for autoscaling groups. Other types of nested stacks (the old LoadBalancer
and DBInstance resources, and provider templates) have not yet implemented
stack updates.

Change-Id: I86e1d5289487b34712c248bc5e68e62cc4651ec6

commit_message:
Fix problem with mocking tasks

It was previously impossible to stub out a task with mox, because when the
TaskRunner attempted to get the __name__ attribute it prompted an assertion
in the mock. Using hasattr() instead of getattr() eliminates this issue.

Change-Id: I3757a77daf59cbb3c0a8b60329d490a89e7ec1d3

commit_message:
Create a Stack.update_task() method

This will allow nested stack resources to run updates in parallel with
other resources.

Change-Id: I184666182f5b9648d2d297d4290eb8608a09c0f0

commit_message:
Make Image Service image formats configurable

Allow configuration of the available image formats
for image creation (corresponds to a feature added
Glance).

Incidentally fixes a test issue where the domain_get
call wasn't being properly stubbed out.

Fixes bug 1216157

Change-Id: Ifc72915d34767ce83f9d85b92ddeae0c2c00b8c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-04 15:14:55.000000000', 'message': "Warn operators not to install openvswitch-brcompat

The LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver VIF driver for the Open vSwitch
Neutron plugin needs to create a Linux bridge using brctl for the
iptables firewall rules that implement security groups. But if the
package openvswitch-brcompat is installed, brctl actually creates an
OVS bridge and the security groups won't work.

bug: #1220358

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/45061

Change-Id: Ia74ffbb4ed327af41f938f900fc105492606b50b
"}]
commit_message:
Warn operators not to install openvswitch-brcompat

The LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver VIF driver for the Open vSwitch
Neutron plugin needs to create a Linux bridge using brctl for the
iptables firewall rules that implement security groups. But if the
package openvswitch-brcompat is installed, brctl actually creates an
OVS bridge and the security groups won't work.

bug: #1220358

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/45061

Change-Id: Ia74ffbb4ed327af41f938f900fc105492606b50b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-05 15:01:37.000000000', 'message': 'Port all rpcapi modules to oslo.messaging interface

Add a temporary nova.rpcclient.RPCClient helper class which translates
oslo.messaging.rpc.RPCClient compatible calls into calls on a RpcProxy
object.

Use this new class to port all of the rpcapi modules over to the new
RPCClient so that the final port of Nova over to oslo.messaging will be
smaller and easier to review.

This patch contains no functional changes at all, except that all client
side RPCs go through this temporary helper class.

blueprint: oslo.messaging
Change-Id: Iee86c36bcc474a604993618b8a2255af8c3d2f48

commit_message:
Port all rpcapi modules to oslo.messaging interface

Add a temporary nova.rpcclient.RPCClient helper class which translates
oslo.messaging.rpc.RPCClient compatible calls into calls on a RpcProxy
object.

Use this new class to port all of the rpcapi modules over to the new
RPCClient so that the final port of Nova over to oslo.messaging will be
smaller and easier to review.

This patch contains no functional changes at all, except that all client
side RPCs go through this temporary helper class.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Iee86c36bcc474a604993618b8a2255af8c3d2f48

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-03 22:43:07.000000000', 'message': "Use tempfile and cleanup in windows unit test

The unit test test_windows was setting and creating
a directory c://iSCSIVirtualDisks in the root path
and even worse wasn't deleting it on cleanup.

This patch converts that to use tempfile and also
adds an shutil.rmtree to the teardown method to clean
up all the junk it creates.

Fixes bug: 1219950

Change-Id: Ibd071c9c3ae9a02f26c85a09e8bc6619d8c73a37
"}]
commit_message:
Use tempfile and cleanup in windows unit test

The unit test test_windows was setting and creating
a directory c://iSCSIVirtualDisks in the root path
and even worse wasn't deleting it on cleanup.

This patch converts that to use tempfile and also
adds an shutil.rmtree to the teardown method to clean
up all the junk it creates.

Fixes bug: 1219950

Change-Id: Ibd071c9c3ae9a02f26c85a09e8bc6619d8c73a37

commit_message:
Add view builder to QoS specs API extension

Add view builder for qos_specs.create(), index(), show() and associations()
to in order to make the response more easier to be consumed by client.

This patch also:
  fixed circular reference error when raising HTTP exception.
  fixed some typo in debug message and removed unused imports.

fix bug: # 1219016

Change-Id: I107888e6b4dac8eb5f1b45a87721a7b5efc45632

[{'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-09-02 16:40:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

IMO we need to have some kind of documentation explaining our plan around Windows compatibility before adding more fixes like this.

Also, is there a bug being tracked for eventlet somewhere about this?  Will it ever support the required features?"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-09-02 16:47:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hi Eric, 

Can you please explain what do you mean with compatibility with Windows?
 
We already have a Windows Storage Cinder driver, so IMO the service cannot fail.

Here's the eventlet bug: 
https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/132/eventletmonkey_patch-breaks"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-02 16:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-grenade-devstack-vm http://logs.openstack.org/44/44744/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/e5a31e5 : SUCCESS in 19m 51s
'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-09-02 17:08:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The problem I currently see is that someone a) writing code for Cinder or b) reviewing code for Cinder, doesn't know where they need to be concerned about Windows compat and where they don't.  Where may other fixes like this be needed?  (Given that we don't run gate tests against this environment, surely things will continue to break...)

Is the only important path the route from bin/cinder-volume to your driver (and whatever is in-between), or are there other places of concern too?"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-09-02 17:14:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In Cinder, for the moment only the Windows driver. 

Note: I'm not counting python-cinderclient here.

Pedro: would you like to add something more to this topic?

In general, I don't see why we shouldn't be able to run all OpenStack components on Windows. A gate is under development for Nova, so we can extend it to Cinder. I can assure that the fact that things keep on breaking on Windows is a big pain for us, so the CI gate is a top priority."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-09-02 19:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Good questions Eric!  I am also curious about what backing filesystems have been tested with Windows/HyperV.  I have been trying to get storwize_svc working for the last week and have encountered a number of issues.  Just curious what environments you guys have working already.'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-09-02 19:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Jay, we are mainly referring to the Windows Storage Server driver maintained by pnavarro, see: 

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/tree/master/cinder/volume/drivers/windows'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-09-02 20:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> In general, I don't see why we shouldn't be able to run all OpenStack components on Windows.

Well, I'm not opposed to it.  But "should be able to" vs. "the project actually makes some attempt for this to have a reasonable chance of success" are two different things in my opinion, and it's not at all clear what the plan is around all of this.  Anyway we clearly need to punt this off to a mailing list discussion rather than try to sort it all out in this review. :)

Please stick a comment in the code explaining the monkey_patch change (probably including some reference to the eventlet bug).'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2013-09-03 09:33:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I've added an inline comment reasoning the monkey patch change."}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2013-09-03 10:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-03 11:10:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Fixes cinder-volume service startup on Windows

The Windows service fails due to missing non-blocking IO features
in eventlet. This fix adds a conditional path on Windows to execute
the service accordingly.

Fixes bug: #1219896

Change-Id: I74f662e736e3a5fe58a383d172780a691a2b36c7

commit_message:
VMware: clean up get_network_with_the_name

By default the method returns None. No need to do this explicitly.

Change-Id: Ie18300bdfaaec8d9c813352fe42a2aebec730c45

commit_message:
fix: claimed message require claim_id to delete

But bulk deletion can still delete both unclaimed and claimed
messages.  However, the major purpose to support bulk deletion
is to make it easy for a user to issue a DELETE on the Location
header returned from a POST; if a user intend to use claim, then
this URI does not help.

Change-Id: Ieed92fc0a07d2e873b729242fb2fb14536462780
Closes-Bug: #1215484

These dummy urls are obviously invalid, but could potentially trigger
unexpected failures due to the underscores.

that these will never resolve.

Change-Id: I2723b18ef3eba81ee8c8a22d866ceb79c00aad75
"}, {'created': '2013-09-03 23:13:22.000000000', 'message': "Change _testnoexisthost_ references in tests

commit_message:
Change _testnoexisthost_ references in tests

These dummy urls are obviously invalid, but could potentially trigger
unexpected failures due to the underscores.

Instead use RFC2606's recommended test TLD of '.test' ensures
that these will never resolve.

Change-Id: I2723b18ef3eba81ee8c8a22d866ceb79c00aad75

"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-08-28 02:55:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(8 inline comments)

Thanks for this, very exciting.

A bunch of inline comments, but now a suggestion for a different approach. We've managed to make it this long without the engine requiring service admin credentials and it would be nice if this continued.

How about trusts.create gets called only in heat-api StackController.create() (or in middleware ideally only for stack create calls). 

This would mean the guts of KeystoneClient.trust_context() would move into StackController or its own dedicated middleware

This could have the following advantages:
- RequestContext gets fully built in the API, as it should be. No more trust-setting side-effects happening to RequestContext later in requests.
- no need to configure engine with admin_tenant_name, admin_user, admin_password, auth_url
- use_trusts (or whatever replaces it) and trusts_delegated_roles config moves to heat-api, leaving no new special config required at all for engine (you are using trusts if the trust_id is set in the context)
- lots of code in this changeset gets tidied up, because there is always a trust_id created elsewhere, only once."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-08-28 03:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-08-28 04:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-08-28 12:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

Some comments in reply to stevebakers review.

I like the idea of moving this to a new paste filter, seems cleaner that either this approach in the engine, or moving the logic into (all the) APIs'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-08-28 13:03:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Actually, we can't move this to a paste filter, or the API, because we need access to the DB to get the stored trust_id, it's not something we are ever passed as part of an actual API request..."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-08-28 14:33:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Agree with SteveB that it would be nice to continue to keep the service credentials away from the engine, but OTOH it would also be nice to continue to keep the DB access away from the API. I would definitely compromise the former before the latter.

Getting a token requires both the trust id and the service credentials, so at some point you need access to both the database and the service credentials either in that order or at the same time.

The only way to achieve both would be to bake the trust id into the callback URL we give to Ceilometer. One glaring problem with that is that if we have a public API that impersonates you given only a trust_id, then the trust_id becomes too sensitive to include in a URL. OTOH, we do require the URL to be signed, so it's not *really* a public API... getting a URL with a trust id in it wouldn't allow you to do any more than you can if you get the URL now. And trust ids are tied to a particular trustee, so the decisions of other services about whether trust ids are sensitive will not affect/be affected by what we decide."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-08-28 17:22:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-08-28 17:24:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Still WIP, fixed up existing tests, still working on adding coverage for the new code'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2013-08-28 18:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Migrate the stored user_creds, which currently only supports
storing username/password credentials to use the keystone v3
API OS-TRUST extension, which allows explicit impersonation of
users calling heat (trustors) by the heat service user (the
trustee)

Note this feature is made optional via a new config option,
defaulted to on, and it requires the following patches to
keystoneclient (not yet released) and keystone to work:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39899/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42456/

Currently this is just a work-in-progress, needs tests and
most probably doesn't work properly - feedback welcome on
the general approach tho :)

blueprint heat-trusts

commit_message:
Migrate stored credentials to keystone trusts

Migrate the stored user_creds, which currently only supports
storing username/password credentials to use the keystone v3
API OS-TRUST extension, which allows explicit impersonation of
users calling heat (trustors) by the heat service user (the
trustee)

Note this feature is made optional via a new config option,
defaulted to off, and it requires the following patches to
keystoneclient (in 0.3.2 release) and keystone to work:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39899/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42456/

Also note that if the feature is enabled, by setting
deferred_auth_method=trusts in heat.conf, you must add
a keystone_authtoken section, which is also used by the
keystoneclient auth_token middleware.

blueprint heat-trusts

Change-Id: I288114d827481bc0a24eba4556400d98b1a44c09

commit_message:
Clean up data when store receiving image occurs error

Clean up already received data from backend store to prevent potential
leaking when driver receiving image occurs error such as
ImageSizeLimitExceeded exception.

Fixes bug: 1214276

Change-Id: Ice1de4d1c61a62fff778acbbeb9bc27d03ed7ab4
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-07-30 17:06:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

I know this is all still subject to change based on our offline discussions regarding deprecating the local queue file. But there are some issues here I wanted to note in any case.

In general it looks like you're chasing after the right problems with the right solutions.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-07-31 14:42:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

sorry for the -1 :) Actually, I'm not really like the "lock". Based on my understanding, the scrubber action can be also take it as a "task". That means we'd better to resolve the race condition issue by "task". In other words, I'd like to see Glance do what Nova does. You know, now the "task" of Glance is coming. So I'd like to leverage the "task state" to avoid the race condition. See this: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/api.py#L123'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-08 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

I've left a few minor notes inline, but it would really help me a ton if we could somehow break this patch into smaller logical steps.

I've included some minor notes inline, but mostly I'd love to work together to try to better understand both the existing logic in scrubber and the changes that are made here.

Finally, I think that a good portion of scrubber operation is already based on the idea that you are running it directly on the glance api nodes. Well, there are two forms, IIUC. In one form, you run a single deployment of glance-scrubber, and it pulls entries from the database for cleanup. In another, it runs on glance-api nodes and pulls from a local queue file. It doesn't seem to me like this patch changes any of that architecture, but i could be wrong, as I am quite confused about how scrubber works when I look at the code."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-08-21 22:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hello John and markwash thanks for you great review and worth comments. I'd like explain my thoughts here to try to resolve your concerns. It's a bit long but easy to understand :P


* How does this effect a horizontal scale out?
As markwash mentioned there are two forms about scurbber deployment, 1) you can deploy glance-scurbber service to glance-api nodes directly or 2) run a single deployment of glance-scrubber. Approach 1) will using queue-file mechanism to delete image data from backend (one or more location). And under 2) scurbber will pulls entries from the database for cleanup, user need enable 'cleanup_scrubber' option. So IMO there are two scale out approach: The first one is just using 1) deployment architecture, run glance-scurbber service on each glance-api nodes, this way allow scale out glance-scurbber with glance-api service, and each glance-scurbber only handle local glance-api image removing request. My second way is that IMO we can change glance-scurbber cleaup mode logic to allow user can deploy scurbber service to more the one node under cleanup mode, and each glance-scurbber deployment/node just handle partial image set, we can adding some new options to control this partition logic, such as image owner, store schema/type or tag.


* What's this change doing?
@markwash this change actually not change current architecture, you are right. As this patch's commit message mentioned this change allow store code and glance-scurbber support multiple-location of the image. If we not do this change then current delay deletion logic will be break, the exception will be raised when user ask delete image with multiple locations. I have not change 'cleanup' logic in the change, but this absolutely is a critical part to me, as we discussed in IRC early, if we want glance-scurbber 'cleanup' mode support multiple-location we have to add a new column to DB, since 1) on 'cleanup' mode scurbber always get image information from DB but queue-file 2) currently on 'cleanup' mode scurbber always assume image only has one locations, that means if image under 'pending_delete' status then all the locations belong this image will all be removed from backend by scurbber, but this is not good for real, user probably only want remove one location from image but not all location. So from above 2 points, IMO we need add a status property to image's location, actually this is separated BP and patch at [1] (thanks John help review it ;)). And also this change, adding 'status' to location, is also good for incoming changes, you know I'd like to move/add some properties to location level from image level, such as 'is_public' and probable 'size, 'checksum', 'format'. Of cause markwash, we maybe need a clearer vision of what all we want on locations, if we grow incrementally without something like the final picture in our minds, we'll end up repeating past mistakes. so i keep location-status change separated and keep minimal change to this patch just allow scurbber and store code support multiple-location situation."}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-08-22 07:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[1]

commit_message:
Scrubber refactoring

* Adding multiple locations image support.
* Adding lock protection to prevent race condition between glance-api
and glance-scrubber service.
* Refactoring scrub queue code.

Implement bp: glance-scrubber-refactoring
docImpact

Change-Id: I050ff212d73ace8e84dcd800245b608210d6b29a
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Powervm driver now logs ssh stderr to warning

The run_vios_command, run_vios_command_as_root methods in
blockdevice.py and operator.py of powervm driver currently log
stderr at debug level, this commit changed it to log to warning
level rather than debug.

Closes-Bug: #1215019
Change-Id: I903067476049ead01c6c34392342d915917790b3

commit_message:
Update keystone wsgi httpd script for oslo logging

When updating to the oslo logging module, it appears that this script
was missed, and erroneously still references .DEBUG, which is not
available in the oslo logging module.  This commit corrects the issue
and updates the reference to oslo log module to not be aliased to
"logging".

The extra logic to set the debug on the instantiated logger is still
needed to ensure all logging is seen (startup config logging, etc).

fixes-bug: 1220012
Change-Id: If5b4f9f28cb9d05f914848cbdb54b10c2c5f3b2d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 02:32:38.000000000', 'message': "Guest-assisted-snapshots for GlusterFS volumes

Note: this still requires integration with Novaclient to
be complete

Coordinate with Nova to create and delete snaphots online for
GlusterFS volumes.

Cinder is responsible for creating a qcow2 file which Nova
will activate in the VM's snapshot chain.

Implements blueprint qemu-assisted-snapshots

Change-Id: I4a7f0c1bc08d88b0f75d119168dd2077487a62a0

"}, {'created': '2013-08-21 19:09:03.000000000', 'message': "QEMU-assisted-snapshots for GlusterFS volumes

Coordinate with Nova to create and delete snaphots for
GlusterFS volumes that are attached to VMs.

Cinder is responsible for creating a QCOW2 file which Nova
will activate in the VM's snapshot chain when a snapshot is
created.

When a snapshot is deleted, Cinder will request for Nova to
perform a block commit/rebase operation to logically delete
the snapshot from the QCOW2 chain.

Implements blueprint qemu-assisted-snapshots

Change-Id: I4a7f0c1bc08d88b0f75d119168dd2077487a62a0
"}, {'created': '2013-08-26 00:10:41.000000000', 'message': "QEMU-assisted-snapshots for GlusterFS volumes

commit_message:
QEMU-assisted-snapshots for GlusterFS volumes

Coordinate with Nova to create and delete snaphots for
GlusterFS volumes that are attached to VMs.

Cinder is responsible for creating a QCOW2 file which Nova
will activate in the VM's snapshot chain when a snapshot is
created.

When a snapshot is deleted, Cinder will request for Nova to
perform a block commit/rebase operation to logically delete
the snapshot from the QCOW2 chain.

Implements blueprint qemu-assisted-snapshots

Change-Id: I4a7f0c1bc08d88b0f75d119168dd2077487a62a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-15 15:30:34.000000000', 'message': "added parameters to control the behaviour

test.py is a modified copy of validate.py. I introduced a new
name to not cause race conditions with the existing Jenkins
job which actually uses validate.py.

This patch introduces the following new parameters and changes
the default behaviour of the script. By default the script will
do nothing.

--check-build: With this parameter the script tries to build
               all books affected by modified files.

--check-syntax: With this parameter the script checks if modified
                files are still using valid XML syntax.

--with-niceness: Using this parameter together with --check-syntax
                 will also check the syntax for niceness issues (for
                 example trailing whitespaces).

--non-voting: With this parameter set the script always returns 0
              as exit code.

Possible Jenkins jobs:

./tools/test.py --check-build
./tools/test.py --check-syntax
./tools/test.py --check-syntax --with-niceness --non-voting

The force parameter is also available (as in validate.py). But
I think it's not meaningful to force the build of all books
or the syntax check of all files because this will result again
in very long runtimes.

We should not use the --non-voting parameter on Jenkins. It should
be possible to simply define non-voting jobs. Then the job is
failed in the review request, but Jenkins still gives +1.

Change-Id: I2ed6f80beb109c60bd7f0ca2417426f776383973
"}]
commit_message:
added parameters to control the behaviour

test.py is a modified copy of validate.py. I introduced a new
name to not cause race conditions with the existing Jenkins
job which actually uses validate.py.

This patch introduces the following new parameters and changes
the default behaviour of the script. By default the script will
do nothing.

--check-build: With this parameter the script tries to build
               all books affected by modified files.

--check-syntax: With this parameter the script checks if modified
                files are still using valid XML syntax.

--with-niceness: Using this parameter together with --check-syntax
                 will also check the syntax for niceness issues (for
                 example trailing whitespaces).

--non-voting: With this parameter set the script always returns 0
              as exit code.

Possible Jenkins jobs:

./tools/test.py --check-build
./tools/test.py --check-syntax
./tools/test.py --check-syntax --with-niceness --non-voting

The force parameter is also available (as in validate.py). But
I think it's not meaningful to force the build of all books
or the syntax check of all files because this will result again
in very long runtimes.

We should not use the --non-voting parameter on Jenkins. It should
be possible to simply define non-voting jobs. Then the job is
failed in the review request, but Jenkins still gives +1.

Change-Id: I2ed6f80beb109c60bd7f0ca2417426f776383973

commit_message:
Skip DHCP variables for Nova Network FlatManager

Set the force_dhcp_release flag to False and do not set the
dhcpbridge_flagfile as well when the NETWORK_MANAGER is set
to the Nova Network's FlatManager as that does not support DHCP

Change-Id: I102033ccdcbd9da566082e740effc1c5fb49af45

The LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver VIF driver for the Open vSwitch Neutron
plugin needs to create a Linux bridge using brctl for the iptables firewall
rules that implement security groups. But if the package
openvswitch-brcompat is installed, brctl actually creates an OVS bridge and
the security groups won't work.

bug: #1220358
Change-Id: Ia74ffbb4ed327af41f938f900fc105492606b50b
"}]
commit_message:
Warn operators not to install openvswitch-brcompat

The LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver VIF driver for the Open vSwitch Neutron
plugin needs to create a Linux bridge using brctl for the iptables firewall
rules that implement security groups. But if the package
openvswitch-brcompat is installed, brctl actually creates an OVS bridge and
the security groups won't work.

bug: #1220358
Change-Id: Ia74ffbb4ed327af41f938f900fc105492606b50b

commit_message:
Adds a Cell scheduling section to the Compute Cells configuration.

Want to add admin user info on how to add a scheduler hint
to launch a new VM where you want to.

Also not sure if --woffset and --wscale are now in use.

Partial fix bug 1187290

Change-Id: I252577b15fd4ac30ed943cc6ffa015e7e3203909

in the active / passive section.

In this manual, the service is installed on API nodes and is managed by
Pacemaker cluster manager.

commit_message:
Document Ceilometer Agent Central in HA

Explain how to bring highly available Ceilometer Agent Central service
in the active / passive section.

In this manual, the service is installed on API nodes and is managed by
Pacemaker cluster manager.

Change-Id: I1653ffe4908918efbb3beeac036abd8581432dcb
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
extract 'limits.' to constant for ratelimiting logic

based on the equal nova code at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41267/ the ratelimiting logic
uses a constant to parse the limits.

Change-Id: I8ffb4267834c79d056716a2c412ecb2c97217635

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': "Introduce periodic state synchronization with backend

Blueprint nicira-plugin-get-improvements

With this patch GET operations on the Nicira plugin will not
be forwarded anymore to the NVP backend.
Resource operational status will be periodically retrieved from
the NVP backend using a DynamicLoopingCall.
The process has been designed with the aim of avoiding:
1) frequent queries to NVP for retrieving a resource's status
2) execution of large queries to NVP for retrieving the status
   of a consistent number of resources.
The process can be tuned using a set of conf variables.
GET operations will now return a status which might differ
from the actual status of the resource. For retrieving status
in a punctual way, the field 'status' should be explicitly
specified in the GET request (show only in this patch)

Change-Id: Ia745b80d2826de32ba8d6883c0d6e0893047e123

commit_message:
Introduce periodic state synchronization with backend

Blueprint nicira-plugin-get-improvements

With this patch GET operations on the Nicira plugin will not
be forwarded anymore to the NVP backend.
Resource operational status will be periodically retrieved from
the NVP backend using a DynamicLoopingCall.
The process has been designed with the aim of avoiding:
1) frequent queries to NVP for retrieving resource status
2) execution of large queries to NVP for retrieving the status
   of a consistent number of resources.
The process can be tuned using a set of configuration variables.
GET operations will now return a status which might differ
from the actual status of the resource. For retrieving status
in a punctual way, the field 'status' should be explicitly
specified in the GET request (only 'show' support has been
implemented in this patch)

This patchs also makes some changes to the fake nvp api client in
order to ensure each instance has a private set of dictionaries for
fake nvp entities.

Change-Id: Ia745b80d2826de32ba8d6883c0d6e0893047e123

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 17:10:58.000000000', 'message': 'Log network changes as INFO rather than DEBUG.

Significant changes such as creating or deleting bridges, IP addresses,
routes, and network devices can seriously affect the functionality of
the node.  We should log them as INFO so they show up by default, to
give administrators a better chance to see the source of possible
network problems.

Fixes bug #1214036

Change-Id: I45e12791f36f64d681f868ea1fe69249e0534e6e

commit_message:
Log network changes as INFO rather than DEBUG

Significant changes such as creating or deleting bridges, IP addresses,
routes, and network devices can seriously affect the functionality of
the node.  We should log them as INFO so they show up by default, to
give administrators a better chance to see the source of possible
network problems.

Fixes bug #1214036

Change-Id: I45e12791f36f64d681f868ea1fe69249e0534e6e

commit_message:
Alarm history storage implementation for mongodb

Test coverage is provided by the alarm scenario tests
included in a prior patch.

Partially implements bp alarm-audit-api

Change-Id: I0a6af67659b035c0aab80cfd423f6642214298d8

[{'created': '2013-09-04 12:57:20.000000000', 'message': 'Change resource.resource_metadata column type to Text

The existing resource.resource_metadata column size is 5k chars, which is not enough for some large JSON metadata payload, so change to as Text column to make sure store all JSON string without truncating.

Fixed bug #1220683

Change-Id: I68d5e6dcf3b71c52f3259bbe24269695349bc267
'}]
commit_message:
Change resource.resource_metadata column type to Text

The existing resource.resource_metadata column size is 5k chars, which is not enough for some large JSON metadata payload, so change to as Text column to make sure store all JSON string without truncating.

Fixed bug #1220683

Change-Id: I68d5e6dcf3b71c52f3259bbe24269695349bc267

commit_message:
Thread safe storage

For engines that run task concurrently it is important to serialize
storage access. This commit adds such storage class and uses it
in MultiThreadedEngine.

Change-Id: I1f0a9c5e8a08d3ad0441b86ca5a847af86826b48

commit_message:
MultiThreaded engine and parallel action

1. MultiThreaded engine was implemented to execute tasks in parallel.
2. Added parallel action that executes and reverts tasks in parallel.
3. Examples and tests were updated.

Change-Id: I9a18d9c27825e8e29cf6470224a23fa42d460547

commit_message:
ActionEngine: Save and re-raise exception on flow failure

When a task fails (raises an exception) this exception is saved in the
engine and re-raised after flow is reverted.

Change-Id: I594528c3745ea0da97f5bc5ff8715ba2d0ee2a7b

Pass only required arguments to task

When task is executed, we don't dump all our storage onto it, but
fetch only things that are required.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-28 15:07:10.000000000', 'message': "Action engines: arguments rebinding

There are cases when value flow author wants to pass to task is stored
with name other then corresponding task argument. For that, This commit
adds 'rebind_args' parameter to task block.

There are two possible way of using the parameter: first is to pass
dictionary that maps task argument name to name of saved value; second,
is to can pass a tuple or list of argument names, and values with that
names are passed to task.

Change-Id: I29a40cc8c04679b8b17af92f1f5e8eccb663cccf
"}, {'created': '2013-09-03 13:25:30.000000000', 'message': "Action engines: arguments rebinding

There are cases when value flow author wants to pass to task is stored
with name other then corresponding task argument. For that, This commit
adds 'rebind_args' parameter to task block.

There are two possible way of using the parameter: first is to pass
dictionary that maps task argument name to name of saved value; second,
is to can pass a tuple or list of argument names, and values with that
names are passed to task.

Change-Id: I29a40cc8c04679b8b17af92f1f5e8eccb663cccf
"}]
commit_message:
Action engines: arguments rebinding

There are cases when value flow author wants to pass to task is stored
with name other then corresponding task argument. For that, This commit
adds 'rebind_args' parameter to task block.

There are two possible way of using the parameter: first is to pass
dictionary that maps task argument name to name of saved value; second,
is to can pass a tuple or list of argument names, and values with that
names are passed to task.

Change-Id: I29a40cc8c04679b8b17af92f1f5e8eccb663cccf

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-28 15:07:10.000000000', 'message': "blocks: Implement syntax for saving task results

To indicate how task result should be saved, flow developer adds
'save_as' parameter to task block constructor. This parameter
should be a string indicating a name of storage slot or a tuple
of names, in which case task should return a tuple of values of
the same size.

Only results saved this way are visible to tasks that are executed
later on.

Partially implements blueprint patterns-and-engines

Change-Id: Idcae8acfc142c4773839f67f07590d72bab8c9f3
"}, {'created': '2013-09-03 12:35:52.000000000', 'message': "blocks: Implement syntax for saving task results

To indicate how task result should be saved, flow developer adds
'save_as' parameter to task block constructor. This parameter
should be a string indicating a name of storage slot or a tuple
of names, in which case task should return a tuple of values of
the same size.

Only results saved this way are visible to tasks that are executed
later on.

Partially implements blueprint patterns-and-engines

Co-authored-by: Anastasia Karpinska <akarpinska at griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Idcae8acfc142c4773839f67f07590d72bab8c9f3
"}]
commit_message:
blocks: Implement syntax for saving task results

To indicate how task result should be saved, flow developer adds
'save_as' parameter to task block constructor. This parameter
should be a string indicating a name of storage slot or a tuple
of names, in which case task should return a tuple of values of
the same size.

Only results saved this way are visible to tasks that are executed
later on.

Partially implements blueprint patterns-and-engines

Co-authored-by: Anastasia Karpinska <akarpinska at griddynamics.com>
Change-Id: Idcae8acfc142c4773839f67f07590d72bab8c9f3

This commit adds quick and somewhat dirty implementation of flow
resumption from storage. The idea is that we run flow as normal,
but if task is already in SUCCESS state we don't run it.

Change-Id: Ieeb3ebbf858f8ec99f5ce0822d18c77e1bc6ad68
"}]
commit_message:
Resume flow from storage

This commit adds quick and somewhat dirty implementation of flow
resumption from storage. The idea is that we run flow as normal,
but if task is already in SUCCESS state we don't run it.

Change-Id: Ieeb3ebbf858f8ec99f5ce0822d18c77e1bc6ad68

commit_message:
Make FlowDetail an engine constructor parameter

Engine should run a flow using given flow detail object to track
task states and results. Engine should resume flow if it was
already run using state from given flow detail object.

Change-Id: Iedf73efcb3adcacffaeb85d21b458dc6eeb804a6

> For better or worse, this version comes from Oslo-incubator, while the other one was copied from another project. So maybe it would be better to try to figure out why it doesn't work.

Ok, but we still don't need two copies of supposedly the same script so we should delete one and sync the other with oslo and/or fix in oslo then sync.

It seems the gate uses the tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh, although weirdly this gives different results at the gate than I get locally, so this whole thing seems like a bit of a mess atm."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-09-04 13:43:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

commit_message:
Update script for building documentation

Now documentation built not from source checkouted by Jenkins, but
checked out explicitly from script. Also we checking out, building
and publishing several versions at once. No landing page now
exists.

Change-Id: Ifbb6d989632ad2277bc1194bd9b440597c916851

commit_message:
Add --list support to dib-run-parts.

Our custom dib-run-parts now supports --list for better compatibility
with some OS-provided run-parts tools.

Change-Id: I2feb615b2094d9d6522bfe9b422362223bb8e652
Closes-Bug: #1190521

commit_message:
Revert "Remove instance exists check from rebuild_instance"

This reverts commit 856db7efad3dceda33423bb3708390475c37034c

When evacuate to another host, similar to instance create, nova
compute must make sure the instance not yet exist on the host.

Fix bug 1216501

commit_message:
Specify alternate unit name for compute logs

If installed from package the systemd unit for nova services is
openstack-nova-*, on Fedora this journalctl command will find logs in
both packaged and non packaged cases.

Change-Id: If77ab0cf9e8c68918f34fa6bbb891445cb4722de

commit_message:
Handle volume.resize.* notifications

Cinder sends a notification at the beginning and the end
of the resize process. Those notifications are volume.resize.start
and volume.resize.end. Handle them for proper usage logging.

Fixes: bug #1220377
Change-Id: I94f0c82594f2573749d124e2cc59f7f9ff4b689d

commit_message:
Check instance existance on evacuate

In patch 42746, the check for instance existence was removed from
instance work flow.

But when evacuate to another host, similar to instance create, nova
compute must make sure the instance not yet exist on the host.

Fix bug 1216501

Change-Id: Ifda27fde2c062c93e6356707cc22ce33fc8f10d7

exist in order to rebuild it?

This issue wasn't papered over because we weren't running evacuate with
a valid compute node hostname so the rebuild_instance() gets sent to a

the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

commit_message:
Remove instance exists check from rebuild_instance

This existence check seems completely bogus - surely the instance must
exist in order to rebuild it?

This issue wasn't papered over because we weren't running evacuate with
a valid compute node hostname so the rebuild_instance() gets sent to a
bogus queue.

That call on a bogus queue will fail if we start timing out call()s in
the fake RPC driver when there are no consumers for a topic.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: Iffebf782ab3fbf3f25cceb068ef24813808f5045

commit_message:
On Fedora, use Linux Foundation bzr lsb_release

Installing redhat-lsb-core adds 87M to the install due
to bugzilla #1002342

lsb_release is a platform agnostic script, so this change fetches
a single file via source-repositories from linuxfoundation bzr http
and installs it to /usr/local/bin

Change-Id: I4c979d4eb5e34a753d9143d9dcfe4e5d08f74a0d

commit_message:
Add support for file to source-repositories

Adds a file type to source-repositories to allow individual files
to make use of source-repositories caching.

REPO_DIRECTORY has been rename to REPO_DEST since it is now sometimes
a file.

This change also fixes the incorrect path to the cache-url in the
tar type.

Change-Id: Ib79e41969c982a02f0235318d9f254b39c3c6d93

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-03 13:12:56.000000000', 'message': "Clear *.pyc before run test via tox

run_tests.sh will remove *.pyc before run test, but tox doesn't,
it will cause problem when developers delete a python file and forget
to remove the relative pyc file.

Closes-Bug; #1220234
Change-Id: I8ad2f1e161259bac8b0f488cdc57f66af2e1a666
"}]
commit_message:
Clear *.pyc before run test via tox

run_tests.sh will remove *.pyc before run test, but tox doesn't,
it will cause problem when developers delete a python file and forget
to remove the relative pyc file.

Closes-Bug; #1220234
Change-Id: I8ad2f1e161259bac8b0f488cdc57f66af2e1a666

Comments inline.

If the gateway and/or the DHCP are handled by Neutron, the MAC addresses are automatically setted in the IsolatedNetwork table. And a local proxy ARP will be activated on router interface (into the namespace).

If the gateway and/or the DHCP are handled by an external service (on a provider network for example), the user (admin provider, in general) could specify MAC addresses through the API.

I'll push a new version in few minutes. But still in WIP. No unit tests for the moment :("}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Works for me

commit_message:
Add network isolated extension and base class

This a part of the blueprint isolated-network

This patch extends the network object with attributes to enable or
disable port isolation and to specify the MAC addresses of gateway and
DHCP server.

The DHCP MAC address is used to authorise the bootp broadcasting traffic
and the gateway MAC address is used to unicastify the ARP braodcast
traffic.

If the DHCP server and/or the gateway are handled by Neutron, the MAC
addresses are setted automaticaly.

Change-Id: Id7ac1acf0e8ae8121828620d4b53511957d86808

subject: Fixes: bug #1208847 Adding description length validation in HasStatusDescription. Adding new class called LBaaSHasStatusDescription extending HasStatusDescription that validates the status is in valid LBaaS statuses set Adding test that tests both, description length validation and status validation

"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-08-19 13:35:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

commits msg and comment lines need improvement.

also:
- I'd rather do validations and conversion in the api rather than at the db layer, unless there's a good reason for it.
- this bug appears to be similar to https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1193253 which has been delayed to Icehouse"}, {'account_id': 8446, 'date': '2013-08-26 08:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Hi Salvatore,
When you say "in the api rather than at the db layer", do you mean the update_status() method (https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/loadbalancer/loadbalancer_db.py#L178) ?

If you do, the reasons are:
1. Someone who will update the status not via this method will not be validated
2. Other services that will want to use the status, will get the validation implemented inside.

Or did you mean something else?

Thanks,
Evgeny'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-08-27 00:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

This should be done at the API layer, but that involves a significant refactoring that we are planning for Icehouse.  Rather than change resource attributes ad-hoc we should be consistent across all resources.'}, {'account_id': 6447, 'date': '2013-08-27 07:32:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

mark - I am not sure what do you mean by "API layer".
If lbass driver calls the update_status of an entity there is no "API" call involved. So how a change in the API will protect the resource?
Thanks
Avishay'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-04 06:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-04 06:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Fixes: bug #1208847
Adding description length validation in HasStatusDescription.
Adding new class called LBaaSHasStatusDescription extending HasStatusDescription
that validates the status is in valid LBaaS statuses set
Adding test that tests both, description length validation and status validation

Change-Id: Ic17eef0e0006e6944c912d4d5f67e04ca890cb50

"}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-26 10:52:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks for the patch!

The commit message really needs to be more descriptive and not just include a bug number. It would be good to summarize the issue and how it is solved. We try to keep as much information as possible in the git logs to make offline work easier.

Also - it would be better to add a test for this - to prevent future issues, and it seems like an easy thing to test for, however I will not block the patch on this."}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-08-27 11:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi.

Thanks for the patch. As mentioned, you need to rewrite your commit message: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages
