'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-25 06:47:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Emilien, I'm confused.

Configuration files are still separated in the heat repository:
https://github.com/openstack/heat/tree/master/etc/heat

Are the samples in the repository outdated?"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-08-25 08:30:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In the repo you can find both. But if you follow core project in OpenStack, you can see that the configuration is now generated by CONFIG in Oslo which aims to generate only one configuration file. It's not yet implemented for all projects, but it is for nova, ceilometer and heat.

At the first commit of Heat, I used the multiple files and I made a change to use only one. So IMHO, this patch from Ian should be abandoned.

Thank's"}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-26 01:33:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

In its current state, the puppet module for heat is unusable, there is a lot of duplicated resources. This change is aimed to fix that.

Unfortunately, Heat repository is missing a lot of examples in the single configuration sample file which makes reviewing difficult or impossible to realize. Somehow, some options have been copied/paste from Nova and aren't relevant to Heat. They are present in the sample files and the code itself, which make it hard to understand which options are valid or not.

Can you briefly explain how oslo.config works with Heat?

Is it correct to say: if multiple config files are used, heat-api will use DEFAULT/bind_port from heat-api.conf to determine on which port to bind the service.

Now, if a single configuration file is used, what would be the value to set? DEFAULT/bind_port? heat-api/bind_port?

What about heat-engine? Would it be heat-engine/bind_port in heat.conf?

-1 until we figure out how configuration works with Heat."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-08-27 06:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For reference, Angus has proposed patch [1] which allows for the duplicate bind_port sections which this patch should be outputting.  

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/43697/'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-08-28 14:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

I would like rspec tests to be added for all those changes. A lot of errors could have been caught with tests in the past. We should aim to test all new changes.'}, {'account_id': 8083, 'date': '2013-08-28 21:08:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Consolidate config into single file

Upstream commits [1,2] modified heat to use a single config file.
This modifies the puppet config of each component to use different
sections of the same file.

Some notes about the change:

 - each of heat-api, heat-api-cfn, heat-api-cloudwatch has indvidual
   options for bind_port, bind_host
 - heat-engine options live under DEFAULT (it does not bind to any
   ports)
 - new log_dir global
 - slight fixes to ENCRYPTION_KEY generation for new heat.conf name
 - include rspec tests for api-cfn & api-cloudwatch

Fixes bug 1214824

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39980/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/43697/

Change-Id: I7d8865a809da71696b944ab0654a1f728cd827df

commit_message:
Adds 'instance_type' param to build_request_spec

This change adds a new optional parameter to
scheduler.utils.build_request_spec. It also fixes Bug 1219761
by adding the new 'flavor' for cold migration instead of the
instance current one.

Change-Id: I28ac5f636e22e4d02ad5495b7b50c8226678c413

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-03 00:39:20.000000000', 'message': 'Allow subclasses to modify dict_extend hooks

Partial-Bug 1219991

This change modifies the hook processing for dict_extend routines
to call the method on the instance if a hook is registered as a string.
Otherwise, the callable hook is directly invoked as an unbound method.

This patch fixes hook registration for all extensions except port_binding.
This is because some plugins are currently working around this limitation
by invoking both the global hook and another dict_extend function,
which might either be registered as another hook, or invoked explicitly
before returning the response.
Fixing this would go beyong the scope of this patch.

Change-Id: Ibe78433e6554aa7fdf5156fc75b8339254876e78
'}]
commit_message:
Allow subclasses to modify dict_extend hooks

Partial-Bug 1219991

This change modifies the hook processing for dict_extend routines
to call the method on the instance if a hook is registered as a string.
Otherwise, the callable hook is directly invoked as an unbound method.

This patch fixes hook registration for all extensions except port_binding.
This is because some plugins are currently working around this limitation
by invoking both the global hook and another dict_extend function,
which might either be registered as another hook, or invoked explicitly
before returning the response.
Fixing this would go beyong the scope of this patch.

Change-Id: Ibe78433e6554aa7fdf5156fc75b8339254876e78

commit_message:
db implementation for tasks, initial commit

added support for task api by introducing,
- tasks table via models
- migration script for creating the tasks table
- impl for TaskRepo, Task domain objects, TaskFactory
- methods for sqlalchemy db api

Partially implement bp async-glance-workers

Change-Id: I09750ea397975a52c111c68a01fc7f73a5988d4d

commit_message:
Replace list with dict in AvailabilityZoneFilter.host_passes

Thanks for the patch

I'd like to see some helpers factored out here:

  def handle_sighup(handler):
      if not hasattr(signal, 'SIGHUM'):
          return
      signal.signal(signal.SIGHUM, handler)

  def is_signup(signo):
      ....

  def signo_to_signame(signo):
      ...
      return signame

and for the checks to be based on hasattr(signal, 'SIGHUP') rather than sys.platform != 'win32'"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-08-31 18:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-31 18:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'created': '2013-08-31 18:13:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes issue with SUGHUP in services on Windows

commit_message:
Fixes issue with SUGHUP in services on Windows

Fixes bug: #1217043

The signal module does not have a SIGHUP member on Windows. This
commit adds conditional statements based on the platform to allow the
execution of Oslo based services on Windows.

Change-Id: Ic873ce2a3337b0832055b760607e58df92a3cead

commit_message:
Improves Hyper-V vmutils module for subclassing

Blueprint: hyper-v-wmi-v2

This refactoring is needed to enable subclassing of the
vmutils.VMUtils class to support the Hyper-V WMI V2
namespace.

Change-Id: Id17b066a05d347ad6b34f826f265208cc4bb22a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-30 20:11:19.000000000', 'message': 'Sync rpc from oslo-incubator

This includes the following fixes:

76972e2 Support a new qpid topology
284b13a Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found
9721129 exception: remove
7b0cb37 Don't eat callback exceptions
69abf38 requeue instead of reject
28395d9 Fixes files with wrong bitmode
bec54ac Fix case error in qpid exchange type "direct"
61c4cde Ensure context type is handled when using to_dict
223f9e1 Clarify precedence of secret_key_file
a035f95 Don't shadow cfg import in securemessage
0f88575 Remove redundant global keyword in securemessage
848c4d5 Some nitpicky securemessage cleanups
5c71c25 Allow non-use of cfg.CONF in securemessage
9157286 RPC: Add MessageSecurity implementation
2031e60 Refactors boolean returns
a047a35 Make ZeroMQ based RPC consumer threads more robust
34a6842 On reconnecting a FanoutConsumer, don't grow the topic name
f52446c Add serializer param to RPC service
5ff534d Add config for amqp durable/auto_delete queues
f9f1b4f Revert "Add support for heartbeating in the kombu RPC driver"
1a2df89 Enable H302 hacking check
7bfd443 Avoid shadowing Exception 'message' attribute
99b7c35 Convert kombu SSL version string into integer
c37f6aa Add support for heartbeating in the kombu RPC driver
3006787 Sanitize passwords in _safe_log
dea334a Replace sys.exit by a RPCException
3969355 Fix exception arg typo
22ec8ff Make AMQP based RPC consumer threads more robust
13650b1 rpc: remove some unused serialization code
e204885 Optionally reject messages on exception.
688832f Remove unused zmq relay functionality
719eba4 Don't reconnect to exclusive fanout consumers.

Change-Id: I99d6a1771bc3223f86db0132525bf22c271fe862
Closes-bug: #1178375

commit_message:
Sync rpc fix from oslo-incubator

Sync the following fix from oslo-incubator:

76972e2 Support a new qpid topology

This includes one other commit, so that the above fix could be brought
over cleanly:

5ff534d Add config for amqp durable/auto_delete queues

Closes-bug: #1178375
Change-Id: I99d6a1771bc3223f86db0132525bf22c271fe862

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-31 01:45:37.000000000', 'message': 'Change keystone tenant and user default

Currently, the default auth tenant and user for
glance are set to admin. This is not only
inconsistent with the rest of the modules (where
the tenant defaults to services and the user defaults
to the name of the service: ie: glance), it
is also inconsistent with the glance::keystone::auth
class.

This patch changes the defaults to services and glance
for both the api and registry service.

Change-Id: I3bd6390183c88213ec4bc289ca6be6f2d9c8bdd2
'}]
commit_message:
Change keystone tenant and user default

Currently, the default auth tenant and user for
glance are set to admin. This is not only
inconsistent with the rest of the modules (where
the tenant defaults to services and the user defaults
to the name of the service: ie: glance), it
is also inconsistent with the glance::keystone::auth
class.

This patch changes the defaults to services and glance
for both the api and registry service.

Change-Id: I3bd6390183c88213ec4bc289ca6be6f2d9c8bdd2

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-08-30 23:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Thanks for the patch, but it does do something. See docs on python's MRO

Try this example with and without your patch:

 from oslo.config import cfg

 from oslo import messaging
 from oslo.messaging.server import MessageHandlingServer


 class Bar(object):

     def __init__(self):
         print "I DO SOMETHING"
         super(Bar, self).__init__()
 


 class Foo(MessageHandlingServer, Bar):

     def __init__(self, transport):
         super(Foo, self).__init__(transport, "target", "dispatcher")


 transport = messaging.get_transport(cfg.CONF)


 Foo(transport)'}, {'account_id': 8633, 'date': '2013-09-03 12:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

I did not see it that way. The use of multiple inheritance with MessageHandlingServer.

Thank you for your explanation.'}]

commit_message:
Replace direct type comparison with isinstance comparison.

This is more pythonic, because isinstance compares not only against
given type, but also again all its descendants.

Change-Id: I018ac057980ab2401d3916ac487566995ac877e0

commit_message:
Raise exception for migration with no valid host

If performing a volume migration and the destination host is not valid,
raise an exception.

Change-Id: I6ff326b5a26d992c92ceced04ab1f5b1955464bc
Closes-Bug: #1220170

commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo-incubator

This includes the following changes:

76972e2 Support a new qpid topology
284b13a Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found
9721129 exception: remove
7b0cb37 Don't eat callback exceptions
69abf38 requeue instead of reject

Change-Id: I58051558345cdb94a9ad29edf02acba9952f6f60
Closes-bug: #1178375

commit_message:
Append /usr/sbin:/sbin to the path for searching mongodb

At least on SUSE, it is not installed in /usr/bin,
which means it can not be found as normal user.

Change-Id: I636cb16429962807d9e88ba87e494ac3c7e1e5a9

Yes, message_id is unique, but how can user get this message_id from API level when they using get_meter?'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-08-30 15:23:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The user don't care of the marker value

like doug propose, each paginated endpoint, must return in each object of the list some 'links'.

One of this link will be 'next', that contain the url to get the next page of the pagination.

So the user don't care of what represent the marker_value, because we have built the link to use for him.

Some 'links' already exists for resource in the API documentation: 
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ceilometer/webapi/v2.html

We just need to extends it for resource and to make the same thing for other."}, {'account_id': 7642, 'date': '2013-08-30 15:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

yes, users do not care about the marker value. I have discuss with jd, he think it is not necessary to store this fake meter_id, we only need to generated it on API level. i think his wors make sense:)

commit_message:
Add a fake UUID to Meter on API level

The database model of Meter does not have a unique key while
Resource has resource_id and Alarm has alarm_id. This key
can be used to identify a meter object by one single value.
The value of meter_id is the combination of resource_id and
couneter_name with base64 encoding. The mainly useage of this
key is pagination query.
It is part of bp/paginate-db-search.

Implements blueprint paginate-db-search

Change-Id: I602d0a370921dcfb02b5bc17c909937c35874e23
